title: Job Developer
description:
**Job Developer (Employment Specialist)**

for Workforce Development

Status: Full-time, Union, Non-Exempt

Reports to Program Director

**Annual Salary:** $55,000 - $58,000 - commensurate with education and experience.

**Benefits:**

* Paid time off
* Pension
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Dental insurance
* Vision insurance
* Flexible spending accounts
* 403 (b) retirement plan w/match
* Professional development
* Employee Assistance Program
* Employee Discount
* Union

The Mosholu Montefiore Community Center (MMCC) is a vital community resource that changes the course of lives of Bronx and Manhattan residents to a degree not otherwise possible. Each year, we serve more than 35,000 preschoolers, school age children, teens, adults and senior citizens through our support, enrichment, education, and recreation programs, expanding their opportunities to live full, productive lives.

We have a family like working atmosphere where everyone works as a team. Join us in building communities one life at a time and build relationships that last a lifetime.

**Major Responsibilities:**

* Provide career and educational assessment and employment development services to young adult participants who are between the ages of 18 and 24 years of age. Assist with participant screening, individual career planning and employment retention services.
* Expand internship and employment opportunities for participants by developing relationships with local businesses and hiring agencies using recent labor market information.
* Place participants in appropriate internship and employment opportunities based upon the individual’s career goals, skills and interests. Maintain communication with students regarding applications, interviews, hiring process and documentation.
* Facilitate curriculum-based work readiness training that will address potential barriers to continuous employment.
* Ensure all participants have a complete employment portfolio, including resumes, cover letters, references and LinkedIn accounts and provide job coaching as appropriate.
* Ensure participants are equipped for self-directed job searches.
* Refer students as appropriate to the College Bound program for college prep services.
* Monitor, track and report on participants’ internship, job placement or post-secondary and/or training progress for the purposes of program and contract reporting of outcomes.
* Advocate for reasonable accommodations at workplaces to ensure participants can perform their job duties effectively.
* Work closely with employers to promote an inclusive and supportive work environment.
* Foster self-confidence and self-advocacy to enhance participants' ability to navigate workplace dynamic.
* Worksite assessment and monitoring including regular visits to observe participants on the job.
* Refer students as appropriate to Social Worker for crisis intervention services and for the purposes of removing barriers to employment.
* Represents the program at job fairs, community meetings and training for the purposes of internship and job development and recruitment of participants.
* All other job-related tasks as assigned by the supervisor.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor's degree in education, counseling, social work, or a related field.
* Experience and cultural competency in working with underserved at risk youth populations, including students with IEPs and other mental health barriers such as depression, anxiety, ADHD, etc.
* Ability to make sound decisions to secure the safety and well-being of all program participants.
* Strong organizational, communication, interpersonal and written skills
* Ability to work both independently and as part of a team to achieve common goals.
* Knowledge of standard teaching methods to young adults including job readiness practices, methods, and techniques
* Ability to maintain accurate data, reports, attendance, and other records.
* Knowledge of community resources
* Ability to multi-task, be self-sufficient and take initiative.
* Work as part of a team to support the fulfillment of the organizational mission as well as the achievement of departmental and contractual outcomes.
* Follow all agency and program policies and procedures and high demonstration of integrity.
* Familiarity with Microsoft Office Suite: Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Google, and other basic computer functions.

**Job Type:** Full-time, Union, Non-Exempt

**Schedule:** Monday – Friday, 9 am – 6 pm and weekends as needed

**Annual Salary:** $55,000-58,000, commensurate with education and experience

**To Apply:** Send resumes, cover letters and questions to Yuisa Santiago, Workforce Development Program Manager, Ysantiago@mmcc.org Your cover letter must address your qualifications for this position, salary requirements and your interest in MMCC.

*We are looking for individuals with a high level of maturity, respect for others, the ability to work as a team, and an appreciation for a multicultural workplace.*

**EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. DRUG FREE WORKPLACE.**

MMCC is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to cultural competency, diversity, and inclusion and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by the applicable law.

title: Associate Account Executive - Public Relations
description:
**Berman Group**

Berman Group is a full-service communications firm, annually recognized on the Observer's “National Power 50 PR Firms List” as one of the top agencies in America. We are a globally recognized agency, collaborating with premier real estate, finance, luxury, lifestyle, and hospitality brands and clients. Our services include Creative Design and Brand Strategy, Event Production and Management, and Public Relations and Social Media. More information about Berman Group can be found at: www.bermangrp.com

**Job Overview**

Berman Group is seeking an Associate Account Executive to join our Public Relations team. We are looking for a motivated, organized individual who can think outside the box. In this role, you will work closely with a team of communications professionals with decades of combined public relations and social media experience. You will also collaborate with our Creative Design studio and Events team to create multi-faceted communications campaigns for industry-leading real estate, lifestyle, and hospitality clients. This is a hybrid position, requiring some mandatory time in our New York City office.

Responsibilities:

* Assist with day-to-day management of multiple public relations-focused accounts
* Facilitate smart and thoughtful collaboration with the management team
* Ensure client requests are handled promptly
* Communicate in a solutions-oriented manner and ask questions to expand your knowledge
* Work with the team to secure media coverage for clients
* Develop compelling social media content and creative initiatives
* Build relationships with influential reporters and editors
* Research speaking opportunities, new outlets, and potential collaborators to suggest to clients

Qualifications:

* Mandatory 1-2 years of public relations experience, including internships
* Organized individual who is proactive and thoughtful in their work
* Excellent written communication skills
* Experience and familiarity with lifestyle, real estate, business, and design media outlets
* Proficient in social media and knowledgeable about influential Instagram, TikTok, and Facebook accounts
* Excellent interpersonal communication skills
* Works well in a team-based, fast-paced environment

Berman Group’s philosophy revolves around a comprehensive approach that anticipates future trends and challenges while crafting bespoke strategies that keep our clients ahead of the curve. We ensure that every initiative resonates deeply with our clients’ target audiences, leaving an indelible mark and propelling them to new heights. We redefine the traditional role of a communications firm by orchestrating a unique and seamless array of services. From launching groundbreaking global campaigns to fostering unparalleled creative collaborations, our work integrates all aspects of communication, including brand creation, event production, public relations, social media, and comprehensive campaign oversight.

title: Resource Mangement Coordinator
description:
**ABOUT US**



PARTNER offers full-service engineering, environmental, and energy consulting, and due diligence services throughout the Americas, Europe, and around the globe. As a leading firm in the Commercial Real Estate (CRE) industry, we have 1200+ employees in more than 40 offices. We want to be the best home for talented professionals in our field! We know that if we hire the best and the brightest, the clients will come, and we will continue to build our company. Our internally focused mission has led to Partner being recognized on ENR’s Top 500 Design Firms List, Inc. 5000’s Fastest-Growing Private Companies in America, and Zweig’s Best Firms to Work For. Our entrepreneurial environment is one where each person can have an impact. Check out this role and join our team of talented people!



Learn more about Partner at www.partneresi.com.


**SUMMARY**



Partner Engineering and Science is seeking a full-time Resource Management Coordinator in our Asbury Park, NJ office to assist our Director of Resource Management and the subcontractor team. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 3 years of administrative experience working in an office environment.


**ESSENTIAL DUTIES & TASKS**


* Perform data entry following prescribed or established formats

* Compose and/or draft correspondences
* Prepare excel spreadsheets with subcontractor data

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES**

* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with strong analytical skills

**COMPENSATION**



Salary range: $21/hr to $25/hr. This is what we reasonably expect to pay for the role

You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary incentive bonus program which is dependent on various factors, including, but not limited to individual and organizational performance.

title: Part time BCBA needed for school program in Norwood, NJ
description:
INVO is hiring! We are seeking a part time BCBA for a school program in Norwood NJ. he Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) is responsible for developing, implementing, and monitoring behavior intervention programs for students with special needs. The BCBA will work closely with teachers, school staff, and parents to create and maintain effective behavioral strategies that enhance student learning and socialization in the school environment.

### **Key Responsibilities:**

* **Behavior Assessments:** Conduct Functional Behavior Assessments (FBAs) to identify the causes of challenging behaviors and develop targeted behavior intervention plans (BIPs).
* **Intervention Development:** Design, implement, and monitor individualized behavior intervention plans (BIPs) for students based on assessment data and evidence-based practices.
* **Data Collection & Analysis:** Collect and analyze data on student behaviors to evaluate the effectiveness of interventions and make necessary adjustments.
* **Collaboration:** Work collaboratively with teachers, paraprofessionals, school psychologists, and other staff to implement behavior plans and support student progress.
* **Training & Support:** Provide training and ongoing support to school staff and parents on the implementation of behavior intervention strategies and positive behavior supports.
* **IEP Development:** Participate in Individualized Education Program (IEP) meetings, contributing to the development of goals and objectives related to behavior.
* **Crisis Intervention:** Provide crisis intervention support as needed, including the development of crisis plans and de-escalation strategies.
* **Consultation:** Offer expert consultation to school teams on best practices in behavior management and student support.
* **Documentation:** Maintain detailed and confidential records of assessments, behavior plans, progress monitoring, and communications with stakeholders.
* **Professional Development:** Stay current with best practices in applied behavior analysis (ABA) and related fields through ongoing professional development.

### **Qualifications:**

* **Certification:** Current Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) certification.
* **Education:** Master’s degree in Applied Behavior Analysis, Psychology, Special Education, or a related field.
* **Experience:** Prior experience in a school setting or working with children with special needs is preferred.
* **Skills:** Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills. Ability to work collaboratively with a multidisciplinary team.
* **Knowledge:** Thorough understanding of behavior analysis principles, including the development and implementation of behavior intervention plans.
* **Licensure:** State licensure as a BCBA (if applicable).

**Benefits**:

* Licensure reimbursement
* Competitive compensation with flexible pay options
* Annual Professional Development stipend
* Comprehensive Benefits Package
* 401(k) Retirement Saving Plan with a discretionary company match)
* Professional Liability Coverage
* Professional membership stipend

title: Retail Merchandiser
description:
Join **Hallmark** as a **Part-Time Retail Merchandiser** in **Bayside, NY!** This is your opportunity to represent the world's best-known greeting card brand and play a crucial role in merchandising, creating, and building displays within your territory for a positive shopper experience. We offer you work life integration within the work week, while supporting the business needs. You will be required to service stores based on the scheduling tool you are provided. We offer paid: training, travel time, and mileage reimbursement. Are you ready to **make your mark**?


**JOB OVERVIEW**  

As a Retail Merchandiser, you'll have the opportunity to work independently to showcase your organization and time management skills, your ability to establish retailer relationships, while being the face of Hallmark. You will collaborate with local store teams to optimize product placement and maintain inventory levels as well as support fellow team members with seasonal resets and installations, when needed. On occasion Hallmark may ask you to service another vendor's product in a store that you are assigned to. If that is the case, you will be provided detailed instructions and additional budgeted time.

  




**To learn more about this role, please click** **to watch our retail merchandisers in action.**  

  

**SALARY AND SHIFT DETAILS**

* Your starting pay will be between $16.50 - $16.75 depending on your shift and location.
* This is a Part-Time position with a variable schedule during the work week.
* Weekly hours for this position is between 10 – 15 hours per week
* Availability the week before and after major holidays, which may include weekends is **required**.

  


**YOUR ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE**

You'll perform service work in the Hallmark department of various retail stores such as grocery stores, drug stores, department stores, and mass retailers. The retail merchandiser position consists of three major components:


* **Day-to-day engagement:** You are responsible for the entire Hallmark product display at your assigned stores. Utilizing a mobile device provided by Hallmark, you'll restock, organize, and monitor the inventory of Hallmark products within and outside the Hallmark department. While using your mobile device you will also be in communication with your supervisor, reporting time, providing feedback, and answering surveys for required merchandising activities. Professional and courteous interaction with store employees, management, and customers is also vital for success in this role.


* **Holiday support:** Hallmark's operations revolve around seasonal demand. Leading up to and following holidays such as Valentine's Day, Easter, Mother's Day, Father's Day, Halloween, Thanksgiving, and Christmas, you can expect additional days and extended hours during the work week. On occasions like Valentine's Day, Mother's Day, and Father's Day, you may be required to work on the actual holiday itself, which may include the weekend.


* **Department Resets:** At times, you may be part of a team responsible for **installations and various tasks** like building and installing Hallmark fixtures, relocating card departments and products, as well as resetting card sections. Typically, you will be notified two weeks in advance for remodel assignments. This could include evenings or weekend.


* **One Team Vision:** As a field organization although you are assigned to your specific responsibilities there may be additional work and installation efforts that you will be asked and required to support.



**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**


This is a physically demanding job that requires a high level of energy and a sense of urgency. You will be working on the selling floor as well as in back stockrooms. You must be able to consistently push, pull, lift, and carry cartons, merchandise, and display fixtures up to 30 pounds throughout the workday and up to 50 pounds on occasion. You will also be required to stoop, squat, walk, and stand throughout your workday, and you may be required to climb stairs and step ladders.

  




**BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**


* You're at least 18 years of age.
* You're able to read, write and understand English.
* You have the ability to grasp, pull, lift, and carry products up to 30 pounds frequently and 50 pounds occasionally.
* Able to operate hand-held technology provided to open and read documents and interpret information.
* You have access to a Wi-Fi network and the internet.
* You have reliable transportation to report to assigned locations.


**Prior to applying, please click** **to watch retail merchandisers at work.**

  

**Now's your chance to Make Your Mark—just follow the instructions below to apply.**


You must show how you meet the basic qualifications in a resume or document you upload, or by completing the work experience and education application fields. Accepted file types are DOCX and PDF.  

  

Part-time employees with a work schedule less than 30 hours have access to a variety of voluntary benefits through ; including dental, vision, critical illness, accident insurance, hospital indemnity and minimum essential coverage (preventive care).

title: Snow Equipment Service Technician
description:
Do you have excellent mechanical skills and a passion keeping essential snow equipment running smoothly? Shaw's Garage in Florham Park, NJ is looking for a **full-time Snow Equipment Service Technician** to help us gear up for a busy winter season. If you thrive in a hands-on environment and have experience with snow plows and salt spreaders, this is the perfect opportunity to showcase your mechanical expertise and join a well-established team!


At Shaw's Garage, we value your skills and offer a competitive pay range of **$20 - $40 per hour**, depending on your experience.

**ARE YOU A GOOD FIT FOR THIS JOB?**


As a Snow Equipment Service Technician, your typical day starts with inspecting and troubleshooting a range of snow equipment. From snow plows and salt spreaders to hydraulic lifts and emergency lighting systems, you'll be responsible for ensuring everything is in top working order. Working closely with a dedicated team, you'll diagnose issues, perform repairs, install new equipment, and upfit vehicles with the necessary winter gear. Each day brings new challenges and the satisfaction of knowing your work keeps our community safe and operational during harsh winter conditions.


Schedule: Monday - Friday, 8:00 am - 5:00 pm, with potential for overtime and short Saturday shifts based on workload.

**QUALIFICATIONS FOR A SNOW EQUIPMENT SERVICE TECHNICIAN**

* 2-5 years of relevant experience
* Ability to diagnose, service, and repair mechanical snow equipment
* Familiarity with equipment brands like Fisher or Western
* Valid driver's license and good driving record
* Ability to provide basic tools and meet the physical demands of the job, including lifting heavy objects, walking, pushing, and standing for long periods of time

**ABOUT US**


Since 1977, residents of northern New Jersey have chosen our family-owned business for their automotive and snow equipment needs. Shaw's Garage is proud to be a full-service facility with a team of highly skilled technicians. We specialize in upfitting light-duty trucks, repairing trailers, and servicing snow plows and salter spreaders. New Jersey winters are a serious business! That's why we make it OUR business to sell quality Fisher products, as well as parts for Western and Meyers snow equipment. Whether a customer needs **a snow plow, salter, dump insert, or hydraulic lift gate** installed on their truck or electrical wiring fixed on their trailer, **they know they can rely on us for friendly, professional service**!


Sometimes people wonder how we've managed to operate a thriving business since the 1970s. What's our secret to success? It's simple: we hire the best people who provide the best service. We count on our team to deliver, and they can count on us! To show our appreciation, we offer **great benefits, employee discounts, and a team-oriented environment**. If you're looking for a career with a well-established company, join Shaw's Garage!

**OUR TEAM NEEDS YOU!**


Don't miss this chance to join a supportive and established team at Shaw's Garage. Apply today to become a Snow Equipment Service Technician and maximize your mechanical skills. We're excited to hear from you-take the first step by filling out our quick and easy initial application!

title: Permitting Biologist (Renewable Energy)
description:
### **About us**


We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.


As a trusted voice for many of the world s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.


**About Energy Systems**  


  

We help customers navigate the complex transition to a decarbonized and more sustainable energy future. We do this by assuring that energy systems work safely and effectively, using solutions that are increasingly digital. We also help industries and governments to navigate the many complex, interrelated transitions taking place globally and regionally, in the energy industry.### **About the role**


Do you want to come help lead decarbonization and the advancement of Renewable Energy?


Are you excited about working with a diverse, collaborative team at the world s largest renewable energy consultancy? Do you have a passion for permitting renewable energy projects, and furthering your professional development in a company that truly puts people first?


At DNV our organizational culture and how we collectively influence the world for future generations matters deeply to us. Our team works every day to increase the widespread deployment and operation of renewables to address climate change and positively impact society; endeavors to achieve our purpose through the success of our customers; and strives to be high-performing and innovative. Our approach reflects the equity, respect, and diversity we wish to see in the world.


DNV s Environmental and Permitting Services (EPS) team is growing rapidly, and we are seeking a **Renewable Energy Project Permitting Biologist** to help us provide comprehensive biological and permitting services in North America. You will be responsible for supporting project development, permitting, and owner s engineering activities for onshore wind, offshore wind, solar, energy storage and hydrogen projects, including support for the preparation of local, state, and federal renewable energy permit applications and management plans, Bird and Bat Conservation Strategies, Habitat Conservation Plans, Eagle Conservation Plans and associated environmental impact studies. You may also be engaged in providing inputs to early phase siting and site characterization studies, assisting with field surveys, and assisting with project due diligence activities.


**What we do**


In our EPS team we strive to develop long-term partnerships with our Customers, acting as their trusted advisor from the early site selection stage through to operations. As our Customers are at the forefront of the energy transition, our team focuses on being nimble, highly experienced, and driven by our mission to ensure renewable energy projects are safely and sustainably sited, permitted, and operated.


**Our team**


The EPS team is comprised of siting, environmental, and permitting specialists who work directly with our Customers to help identify and address project risks. Our mission is to guide the sustainable, responsible growth of the renewables industry by providing innovative environmental and permitting expertise to support the greater good.


To facilitate this work, excellent written and oral communication skills are paramount. Broadly, our work falls into three categories:


* Biological services, including field surveys, habitat conservation plans, corporate avian and bat protection plans, review of mitigation strategies, and associated permitting
* Permitting services, providing support for permitting at the federal, state/provincial, and local level for wind, solar, battery storage and hydrogen projects; including stakeholder engagement
* Siting services, including layout optimization, acoustical measurements, noise impact assessments, shadow flicker studies, blade/ice throw assessments, glint and glare studies, and visual impact studies

**This role is based at our DNV office in San Diego (CA), Austin (TX), Houston (TX), Oakland (CA), Portland (OR), Seattle (WA), Medford (MA), Oak Brook (IL), Chalfont (PA), Dallas (TX) or New York (NY), presenting a dynamic hybrid schedule where employees will typically spend three (3) days per week working from either a DNV office or client location/site. Further details regarding role-specific requirements will be shared during the interview process.**


**What You ll Do**


* Support renewable energy project site selection and characterization studies in North America
* Support and prepare regulatory documents such as permit applications, authoring of environmental reporting documentation including critical issues analyses, Bird and Bat Conservation Strategies, Eagle Conservation Plans, Habitat Conservation Plans, mitigation and monitoring plans, offshore Construction and Operations Plans, enforcement action support and associated NEPA documents
* Provide support for technical due diligence reviews of environmental permits for project financing and M&A activities
* Organize consulting activities with different stakeholder groups, including federal and state regulatory agencies such as the USFWS, local communities, and Tribes or First Nations
* Maintain sustainable relationships and good communication with clients, vendors, subcontractors, and other project stakeholders
* Assist in business development activities including preparing proposals for each client/project, maintaining strong client relationships, and attending client meetings to support further service offering expansion
* Participate in DNV s thought leadership activities in coordination with the EPS Head of Section and Team Leads to organize publications, presentations, white papers, and other general scientific and regulatory knowledge-sharing activities related to special analysis for the renewable industry

### **What we offer**

* Generous paid time off (vacation, sick days, company holidays, personal days)
* Multiple Medical and Dental benefit plans to choose from, Vision benefits
* Spending accounts FSA, Dependent Care, Commuter Benefits, company-seeded HSA
* Employer-paid, therapist-led, virtual care services through Talkspace
* 401(k) with company match
* Company provided life insurance, short-term, and long-term disability benefits
* Education reimbursement program
* Flexible work schedule with hybrid/remote opportunities
* Charitable Matched Giving and Volunteer Rewards through our Impact Program
* Volunteer time off (VTO) paid by the company
* Career advancement opportunities


\\*\\*Benefits vary based on position, tenure, location, and employee election\\*\\*

**How We Do It**


We Care, We Dare, We Share


DNV is a proud equal-opportunity employer committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, or business need, without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.


DNV is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity, including providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with a disability. US applicants with a physical or mental disability who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process may contact the North America Recruitment Department (hrrecruitment.northamerica@dnv.com). Information received relating to accommodations will be addressed confidentially.


DNV is proud to announce being named one of Houston s best places to work in the 2022 Houston Business Journal Best Places to Work competition.

**For more information**  

https://www.eeoc.gov/know-your-rights-workplace-discrimination-illegal

**Read more here**  

Diversity and inclusion in everything we do every day - DNV


Meet our employees - DNV


About DNV


Careers in DNV


As required by the Pay Transparency laws in Colorado, New York City, California, Washington, and Connecticut, DNV provides a reasonable compensation range for roles that may be hired in those locations. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors, including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the states of Colorado, New York City, NY, California, Washington, and Connecticut only, the range of starting pay for this role is **$85,000 - $130,000.**

### **About you**

**What is Required**

* Bachelor s degree in a relevant field, namely biology (wildlife, ecology, conservation focus), land planning, environmental science/engineering, or environmental law/policy or related field
* At least 3 years of experience on biology-related components of renewable energy or similar projects, or 3 years of experience in environmental and/or permitting experience in the US
* Experience in:
	+ Preparing or leading Bird and Bat Conservation Strategies, Habitat Conservation Plans, Eagle Conservation Plans or other wildlife management plans; OR
	+ Preparing or reviewing wildlife survey methodology and design, mitigation options, and quantitative risk assessment; OR
	+ Engaging with and contacts within the federal and state regulatory agencies such as the USFWS, local communities, and Tribes or First Nations; and
* Strong written and verbal English communication skills
* We conduct pre-employment drug and background screening

**What is Preferred**

* Master s degree in a relevant field, namely biology (wildlife, ecology, conservation focus), land planning, environmental science/engineering, or environmental law/policy
* 5+ years of relevant experience preferred
* Advanced knowledge of environmental assessment regulatory frameworks as applied to renewable energy (wind, solar, or battery storage)
* Experience leading winning proposal efforts for Customers in the renewable energy industry
* Capable of travelling to projects in development, construction, and operation sites in varying locations (10%-20% annual time)
* Project Management Professional (PMP) or other technical accreditation such P.Eng., P.Geo, P.Biol., etc.

\\*\\*Immigration-related employment benefits, for example visa sponsorship, are not available for this position

title: QA Supervisor
description:
Are you a **bilingual** **Quality Assurance Supervisor** looking to join a quality company with a family-style culture? Do you have a passion for leading a Quality Team? We are looking for a strong leader who can bring quality and food safety expertise and experience to our organization. This position will provide opportunities for you to fully utilize your skills, while adding value to an exceptional company with a stellar reputation!


**About the Company:**


Since 1982, the Del Sol Food Company has focused on our unwavering dedication and commitment to quality by using only the finest ingredients. But it's the people behind our products that make Macy's an amazing one-of-a-kind culture. Family is at the heart of everything we do, as evidenced by the number of our employees who have been with us for a significant number of years. In fact, half of our employees have been with us for over a decade! Our vision for growth is much larger than Cheese Sticks alone, and we're looking for dedicated individuals who desire to grow with us.

**The Position:**


The QA Supervisor is a key member of the quality team and is accountable for the company's overall food safety and quality program, ensuring production of safe and high-quality bakery products for our customers. This individual will be a team player with a hands-on mentality who will be responsible for ensuring food safety and sanitation standards are in full compliance with all regulatory bodies, food certification requirements and company standards. This individual will be the champion of establishing company-wide food safety and quality culture, proactively eliminating barriers to this end, and reinforcing positive behaviors. Participates in projects with corporate cross-functional teams.

**\\*\\***The regular working hours for this position are 8:00am - 5:00pm. This person will also need to have the flexibility to work irregular hours and weekends as needed.

**Position Responsibilities:**

* Site SQF Practitioner, lead the facility in all SQF, Food Safety, Packaging Quality, Product Quality, Sanitation, and related activities.
* Manage site food safety documents, conduct risk assessments, and root cause analysis.
* Responsible for ensuring the highest quality standards and good relations are maintained with customers, regulatory agencies, and certifying bodies.
* Source and conduct pre-screening of potential ingredient and packaging suppliers.
* Manage environmental program, sanitation, and sanitation verification/validation activities.
* Responsible for the development and maintenance of site SOP's and SSOP's.
* Lead in resolving non-conformance issues/quality problems at plant.
* Works with plant management team to develop corrective action plans and communicates plans to corporate QA.
* Conducts assessment and capability studies, product startups/commercialization and provides on-site support to Plant Operations for new products, productivity, and quality programs at the direction of corporate QA/R&D.
* Organize and facilitate sensory evaluations through in-house taste panels at the direction of corporate QA/R&D.
* Serves as a key technical resource in the plant and as a liaison between corporate QA, R&D, and Operations.
* Manage all third-party food safety audits for the location.
* Independently performs data management, analysis, and reporting.
* Prepare regular reports and establish daily accomplishments and efforts toward meeting objectives.
* Perform other duties assigned.

**Qualifications:**

* B.S. in Food Science or Technology, Bakery Science, Cereal Science, Biological Science, or related field.
* 3-5 years of QA/QC management bakery manufacturing experience in a GFSI FDA and/or USDA regulated facility.
* SQF Practitioner, HACCP, and PCQI certification is required.
* Must be detail oriented and organized.
* Must be a self-starter, able to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple projects/tasks at any given time.
* Must demonstrate independent and critical thinking ability, hands-on mentality/ qualities.
* Must be comfortable working with computers and have knowledge of MS office.
* Must be able to work and communicate effectively in a team environment.
* Must be able to work extended hours including nights, weekends, and holidays as needed.
* Must be able to communicate effectively in English and Spanish.

**Desired Skills and Competencies:**

* Must work proactively with all departments in the company.
* Ability to lead, train, and develop team members.
* Must be a teachable leader with a positive attitude and mindset.

**Why work for Del Sol Food Company?**


In addition to joining a fun work environment, our compensation and benefits package are designed to encourage longevity with the company. Below are some of the benefits offered:

* Paid Time Off
* Bonus Potential
* 401k with a match
* Dental, Vision, Health, and Life Insurance
* Growth and Professional Development Opportunities

**Interested?**


Apply today and tell us why you would be a good fit for our **Quality Assurance Supervisor** role!

 ***Del Sol Food Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetics, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected status established by federal, state, or local laws.***

***Disclaimer: Del Sol has considered several points such as cost of living and general industry pay standards when determining the provided salary range. However, final salary packages will be determined by factors such as years of experience and growth potential.***

title: IT Inventory Management Associate in Purchase, NY area
description:
Acture Solutions is seeking a meticulous and efficient IT Inventory Management Associate in the Purchase, NY area to oversee our information technology inventory management.

**Your Role:** As the IT Inventory Management Associate, you will report directly to the Technology Operations Manager. The successful candidate will be responsible for maintaining accurate inventory records, managing stock levels, and ensuring the efficient operation of our inventory systems. This role is crucial to ensuring that our supply chain meets customer needs and operates smoothly.

**Your Impact:**

* Inventory Management:
* Maintain accurate inventory records and manage stock levels.
* Reduce inventory shrinkage through effective controls and procedures.
* Participate in regular inventory audits to identify discrepancies and implement corrective actions.
* Stock Replenishment:
* Determine reorder points, lead times, and safety stock levels to prevent stockouts.
* Coordinate with suppliers to ensure timely delivery of inventory.
* Inventory Data Analysis:
* Analyze inventory data to identify trends and make recommendations for improvement.
* Utilize data to support demand forecasting and inventory planning.
* Demand Forecasting:
* Collaborate with other departments to ensure an adequate supply of products to meet customer needs.
* Contribute to overall inventory control activities.
* Stock Room Organization:
* Optimize stock room layout to maximize space utilization.
* Ensure proper labeling and organization of stock.
* Disposal of Retired IT Assets:
* Manage the disposal process for retired IT assets in accordance with company policies and regulations.
* Perform other related duties as assigned.
* Return Merchandise Authorizations:
* Contacting vendors
* Shipping, receiving, tracking returns.

**Who You Are: Required Qualifications**

* High School Diploma or equivalent
* 2+ years of experience in related field or equivalent
* Lift 25 to 60lbs
* Strong understanding of inventory management principles and best practices.
* Experience with IT inventory and parts tracking.
* Proficiency in inventory management software.
* Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

**Work Schedule:**


This is a full-time position in Purchase, NY area, Mon-Fri, Flexible hours between 7a-5p EST.

**Who We Are:** Acture Solutions has been a trailblazer in the technology solutions industry for over four decades in Upstate NY. Offering innovative 360º IT solutions, we pride ourselves on being the antithesis of traditional MSPs. Under new leadership in the past five years, we have experienced exponential growth, earning recognition on Inc. Magazine's Fastest Growing Companies List for two consecutive years. Our team comprises tenacious analytical people dedicated to delivering excellence to our clients. With plans to double in size over the next three years, we are seeking committed individuals who want to grow with us and contribute to our continued success.

**What We Offer:**


At Acture Solutions, we offer a competitive compensation package that includes a medical insurance plan with zero deductible, vision and dental coverage, a 401k plan, and a generous PTO policy. Our expected annual salary range is **$45,000-65,000**, commensurate with experience. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, valuing a diverse team that consistently delivers high-quality work with a positive attitude.

**Our Culture:**


Renowned for our excellence in the industry, Acture Solutions is at a pivotal point in its journey, shaping an even brighter future. We prioritize a "people first" culture, where respect and quality take precedence over profit. With ambitious standards for quality and performance, we foster a fun, respectful, and inclusive environment where every team member contributes to our collective success.

**Join Us:**


Step into a role that challenges and rewards you in equal measure. At Acture Solutions, we offer a dynamic work environment where collaboration, inclusivity, and impactful projects flourish. Apply now to become a part of our team and help shape our exciting future. Please note that Acture Solutions requires valid driver's licenses and criminal background checks for all positions.

title: Benefits Manager
description:
**ARROW** is one of the largest privately held security guard companies in the United States with a 97% customer retention rate and an average client relationship of over 15 years. Our dedication to customer service runs deep throughout the entire organization and is what sets us apart from the competition. With our continued growth and mission focus we are looking to add a **Benefits Manager** to our team in the Long Island Office.


Passionate about people and culture? The Benefits Manager will be responsible for proactively manage all aspects of our company's employee benefits programs. The position will manage various aspects of benefit administration, from enrollment and communication to addressing employee inquiries. The position will partner with HR leadership to ensure our employees can access comprehensive and competitive benefits, helping to create a positive work environment and supporting our commitment to their well-being.

**Essential Job Duties**

* Administer employee benefits programs, such as group health, flexible spending accounts, dental and vision, accident and disability, life insurance, 401(k), and wellness benefits.
* Prepare and distribute conversion/portability notices to terminated employees as required.
* Lead annual and new hire open enrollment process, including plan implementation/changes and the development of communication materials
* Review and interpret health care data and notices to determine organizational requirements; recommendations to leadership as warranted.
* Resolution of escalated benefit questions and issues, such as health & welfare, wellness, 401(k), and company perks
* Reconcile related invoices in a timely manner
* Manage relationship with all incumbent carriers and providers
* Ensure Cobra compliance with incumbent provider, including qualified beneficiary set ups, required notices and monthly reconciliation as required
* Ensure annual 5500 filings are completed
* Serve as a key point of contact for all eligible leave programs to include FMLA, short-term disability, paid family/sick, military); counsel, administer and ensure compliant tracking as required.

**Position Requirements**

* Seven to ten years of prior experience managing large group health and wellness programs, including management of leave of absence programs
* Expert knowledge of Section 125 plans and related requirements
* Demonstrated proficiency maximizing excel
* Prior experience managing annual ACA filing requirements
* Minimum of 3-5 years prior experience leading support positions in same discipline
* Superior customer service demeanor
* Compliance with ACA, federal and state regulations and requirements
* Ongoing accuracy evidenced through reconciliation and auditing practices
* Implement automation gains
* Fully utilize existing HRIS system for insurance tracking purposes

 **Compensation Range:** $95,000 - $115,000 Annually


Founded in 1985, we have perfected our approach to high quality security. title: Delivery Driver $21.25/hr - Paid Training
description:
Rocket Logistics is a Delivery Service Partner (DSP) to one of the largest ecommerce companies in the world. We operate out of Edison, NJ.

We are looking for enthusiastic, CUSTOMER SERVICE ORIENTED, team players to deliver packages. Our Delivery Drivers strive to get every order to the customer’s door on-time.  
We offer full and part-time opportunities.  
**Branded vehicle provided including opportunity to drive brand new all-electric luxury Rivian vans! Your regular license will do.**  
\\*\\*  
\\*\\*  
Approximate hours are 10 am to 8 pm. Shifts range between 8-10 hours per day and shifts are available 7 days per week.  
**Compensation & Benefits**

* $21.25 / Hour + Qualify for Discretionary Performance-based Bonus; over $31/hr overtime rate during peak times of the year (e.g. Holiday months of Nov-December) – overtime hours allocated based on performance.
* Paid Training
* Paid Overtime and Time Off (PTO)
* Health Insurance and Benefits
* 401K + Company Match!
* $5,250 per year of tuition provided FREE for eligible employees!

---- **Available for CDL training**  
---- Available for college degree courses taken at any accredited institution in the U.S.

* **Opportunity for advancement to drive larger DOT-regulated vehicles - we are currently the only DSP at our station with Box Truck routes to get promoted into (DOT-certification required)**
* Opportunity to be certified to drive beautiful 100% ELECTRIC delivery van.
* Inclusive, welcoming work environment where helping you succeed on the job is our top priority!

**Delivery Driver Basic Requirements**

* Eligible to work in the U.S
* Must be at least 21 years of age.
* **Must have a valid non-probationary driver's license.**
* Successfully pass a pre-employment drug test

**Delivery Driver Duties and Responsibilities**

* Safely drive and operate your delivery vehicle at all times.
* Use hand held device for routing information, customer delivery information.
* Must be comfortable driving and working in varying weather conditions.
* Load and unload packages to be delivered.
* Lift packages up to 60 lbs.
* Be physically able to step up and down cargo vans 150+ times a day.
* **Must be a team player** and enjoy being part of a high-performing team. You will be asked to help other teammates when help is truly needed in order to complete deliveries. As a team, we are responsible for getting packages delivered.

**Why we want you!** Are you physically active? Love to move all day long? Love being part of a team? Do you love making others smile? If you are great at customer service, bring that friendly spirit onto the road!· Is a desk job just NOT for you?· Want your work to positively impact your community?  
**If you answered YES! to the above, then come “ROCKET” with us!**

description:

**Start Date: Flexible, can accommodate anywhere from August to October 1st**

**Responsibilities include:**

All daily care tasks related to G8m; patient bottle feeding, introducing solids, practicing independent sleep habits, logging daily care in Huckleberry app, developmental milestone activities and progression. Light housekeeping is limited to tidying up toys, washing bottles/baby dishes, cleaning up after solids, etc.

**Schedule: Monday-Thursday, approximately 25-30 hours per week.**

Though the position may evolve as the baby gets older, right now Mom is very lucky to have a flexible remote work schedule that varies only slightly week over week. Generally, the 25-30 hours will be broken out as 7a-12p, 8a-3p, or a similar variation.

**Household Notes:** 

Family car is available for out-of-home activities. Family has a friendly senior dog who keeps mom company in her office and will be taken care of by mom.

**Ideal candidate:** 

is nurturing, patient, kind, intentional, highly organized, and professional. They are well-versed in developmental milestones, may have a daycare background, may possess infant-focused training, and would love to grow with the family for years to come.

**Compensation:** 

Family is offering an hourly salary commensurate with candidate experience; ~$30/hr. Position includes industry standard benefits (vacation, sick, federal holidays off).

**Requirements:**

3+ years of infant experience

Eligible to work in the US

Reliable transportation

Clean driving record and criminal background

Fluent English

Dog-Friendly

title: RN Case Management Supervisor-Home Care-Pediatrics
description:
**RN-Pediatric Case Management Supervisor**

**Full Time**

**Monday-Friday 9am-5pm**


Your Choice At Home is an affiliate of Cobble Hill Life Center and a Certified Home Health Agency (CHHA). We're culturally sensitive, and many of our staff come from within the community that they serve. Operating 24 hours, 7 days a week, we offer reliable, dignified care in your own home and specialize in health services, personal care, and champion services.


As the Pediatric RN Case Management Supervisor, you will be responsible for coordinating pediatric patient care services. Reporting to the Director of Patient Services and working collaboratively with the RN Case Manager and interdisciplinary team members, you will ensure services are provided and coordinated according to regulatory requirements.

**What's in it for you?**

* 10% of salary employer contribution retirement plan with a 3-year vesting schedule
* Generous medical, dental, vision, and life insurance coverage
* Employer contribution toward medical deductible (effective day 1 of employment)
* 16 paid holidays plus an additional 31 sick/vacation days (including your birthday!)

**Responsibilities Include:**

* Coordinates patient's care that is cost-efficient and reimbursable under the patient's insurance plan and approved by physician
* Reviews insurance plan information and verifies eligibility with operations department.
* Reviews patients chart to determine all services are provided as per plan of care
* Understands and interprets the CHHA reimbursement policy and determines the billing source for patient care.
* Reviews clinical documentation to ensure care coordination and compliance with plan of care
* Participates in QAPI activities and Quality Improvement chart audits and other activities to ensure quality of care provided by clinical staff.
* Participates in staff development programs including clinical orientation, supervisory field visits, and in-service of clinical staff.
* Reviews documentation to ensure documentation accurately reflects clinical status of the patient and skilled need for CHHA services.
* Reviews clinical documentation to ensure compliance with discipline frequencies and duration of services on 485(physician orders)
* Participates in care coordination meetings to ensure adherence to frequency and duration of services as per physician's order. Reviews patient progress toward goals, continued need for services and discharge planning.
* Communicates frequently with RN Case Manager and interdisciplinary team members to ensure services are provided and revises the goals and interventions to patient care, as needed.
* Acts as a coordinator of the multidisciplinary team providing care to patients
* Creates/updates plan of care with input from appropriate interdisciplinary health team members based on goals mutually acceptable to the patient and family.
* Documents coordination of care in medical record as needed
* Supervision of pediatric nurses including joint visits and annual evaluations as per Department of Health guidelines
* Monitors the effect of the care plans on the patient health status and informs physician and other personnel of changes in the client's needs.
* Initiates and maintains written and verbal communications to assure patient optimal patient care
* Plans, facilitates, and documents patient's discharge from the program.
* Completes all other required documentation in a timely manner.
* Participates in the orientation of pediatric nursing staff.
* Rotates responsibility for weekend and holiday 24 hour on-call coverage with other nurses.
* Performs other related duties and projects, as assigned, including home care visits, orientating new nurses, community outreach and liaison with hospitals and other providers.

 **The ideal candidate will:**

* Have license and current registration to practice as a Registered Professional Nurse in New York State.
* BSN Degree from an accredited school of nursing
* BLS required
* 3+ years of prior experience working in home care/CHHA environment
* Supervisory experience a plus
* Prior experience working with the pediatric population a plus
* Full vaccination for COVID-19 required
* Access to reliable transportation or able to access public transportation reliably and able to transportation within Brooklyn, Queens and Manhattan, depending on case assignment
* Ability to work holidays and weekends on a rotating schedule


Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable an individual with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the position without compromising resident/patient care.

We are rated by CMS as a 5-star facility, with 4 stars in staffing. Our high staffing levels allow Nurses and CNAs to provide excellent and safe care to residents and patients. We put an emphasis on patient safety and staff work satisfaction. We have very high standards of care for patients and residents. Working at United Hebrew means having the opportunity to change lives for the better. You will meet interesting residents with stories to share and amazing co-workers who become friends.

 **Some of the key requirements include:**

* Must be licensed by New York State
* Will be friendly and sociable and be able to provide comfort to patients with good interpersonal skills - both verbal and in writing
* Must be detail-oriented, able to notice any changes in a patient's condition and report changes to our care team
* Requires prior RN experience
* Team member - with a collaborative, team-based work environment, we are looking for individuals who embrace a high level of care, compassion and teamwork
* Vaccinated from Covid-19

title: RN-Home Care Nurse-full Time
description:
**RN-Home Care Nurse**

**Full Time-Monday-Friday**

**$15,000 sign-on bonus!**


Your Choice At Home is an affiliate of Cobble Hill Life Center and a Certified Home Health Agency (CHHA). We're culturally sensitive, and many of our staff come from within the community that they serve. Operating 24 hours, 7 days a week, we offer reliable, dignified care in your own home and specialize in health services, personal care, and champion services.


As the Registered Nurse, you will be responsible for providing and coordinating multidisciplinary home health services for patients in the community. You will work with the physician and other team members in the implementation of the plan of care.

***Now Hiring FT RNs for Queens, Manhattan and Brooklyn visits!***

**What's in it for you?**

* 10% of salary employer contribution retirement plan with a 3-year vesting schedule
* Generous medical, dental, vision, and life insurance coverage
* Employer contribution toward medical deductible (effective day 1 of employment)
* 16 paid holidays plus an additional 31 sick/vacation days (including RN day and your birthday to name a few!)

**Responsibilities include:**

* Provides and coordinates patient care that is cost-efficient and reimbursable under the patient's insurance plan and approved by physician
* Accepts case assignment depending on client's needs in specific geographic location(s)
* Case assignment is all-inclusive of CHHA requirements, including initial assessments, case opening, and documentation on first day of service
* Travels to patients' homes and/or other facilities using approved transportation to deliver direct care to the patient
* Ensures in-person completion of the Oasis that accurately reflects clinical and functional status of the patient. Uses diagnosis Coding skills to accurately rate the acuity of each diagnosis in the Oasis.
* Obtains and evaluates HHRG and HIPPS score and works with the Supervisor on matching the scores to frequencies and duration of services on 485 (physician orders)
* Evaluates patient diagnosis and work with RN supervisor and physician to assign an appropriate primary diagnosis.
* Participates in weekly PPS meetings to report adherence to frequency and duration of services as per physician's order. Reports patient progress to PPS team so that discharge date can be set and anticipated.
* Communicates frequently with PT/OT to ensure adherence to the frequency and duration ordered by the physician.
* Acts as a coordinator of the multidisciplinary team providing care to patients and establishes a care plan with input from appropriate health team members.
* Documents content and process of all services provided and monitors the effect of care plans on the patient's health status.
* Educates the patient and family regarding the disease process, self-care techniques, and prevention strategies.
* Plans, facilitates, and documents patients' discharge from the program
* Admits patient to the program as needed and completes required documentation in a timely manner.

**The ideal RN candidate will:**

* Have at least a minimum of one year of experience as a Registered Nurse from an accredited institution.
* Prior nursing experience in long-term care or CHHA is preferred but not required-**will train new graduates!**
* Must be able to make home visits in potentially unsafe and unsanitary home environments (e.g., elevated buildings, walk ups, care facilities, single/multiple family homes, presence of pets, etc.).
* Access to reliable transportation or able to access public transportation reliably and able to transportation within Brooklyn, Queens and Manhattan, depending on case assignment. Standing, sitting, walking, bending, reaching, stretching, and climbing stairs.
* Able to lift up to 50 pounds unassisted and up to 325 pounds utilizing an assistive device.


Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable an individual with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the position without compromising resident/patient care.

title: Facilities Technician
description:
The Facilities Technician is responsible for assisting the Operations Manager or Manager on Duty with the implementation of safety plans, operating standards and guidelines, troubleshooting, repairs, and performing preventative maintenance required to maintain the physical assets of the property.

**Responsibilities**

* Install, troubleshoot, repair, and maintain various building systems
* Operate a variety of equipment to perform preventative maintenance, minor repairs and maintain cleanliness of property
* Perform a variety of maintenance/minor repair activities on the interior/exterior areas of the property including, but not limited to, painting, drywall, parking lots, sidewalks, plumbing repairs, clears drain stoppages, lighting, flooring, and roof
* Assist with maintaining appropriate inventory systems, records, files, material safety data sheets, supplies, equipment, and tools
* Repair, modify, move retail merchandising units as needed
* Assist in the setup of events and install/take-down mall decor
* Perform interior/exterior custodial duties as needed which may include sweeping, vacuuming, steam cleaning, gathering trash, empty trash receptacles; operate compactor; and landscaping
* Assist with snow removal by vehicle and/or by hand (if applicable)
* Embody and support Brookfield Properties’ Safety, Health, and Environment Policy. Perform the job in accordance with all applicable standards, policies and regulatory guidelines (including OSHA standards) to promote a safe working environment.
* Engage in training and continuing education to develop the knowledge, skills, and competencies required to work safely
* Assist with emergency planning and response in coordination with management team
* Some shift work, evenings, weekends, and emergency response is required
* Provide assistance and interact with the public and tenants as needed
* Other duties as assigned

**Qualifications**

* High School Diploma or GED required
* Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in building maintenance or a related field

* Ability to communicate information clearly with management, employees, tenants, and external contacts
* Ability to read and interpret documents, plans and schematic drawings and comprehend instructions
* Self-starter with ability to work independently
* 2-year Tech School Graduate or trade certificate is a plus
* OSHA General Industries 10-Hour course is a plus
* Familiar with, or ability to learn Microsoft Outlook (email)
* Bilingual welcomed

Core Competencies: Nimble Learning, Collaborates, Drives Results, Customer Focus

title: Assistant Teacher: Preschool
description:

Programs include, Infant, Toddler, Preschool, Pre-K, Before and After Care and Summer Camp.*

Must meet all state requirements.

title: Activity Specialist, After School
description:
**Activity Specialist**

**Job Type:** Part-time

**Pay rate:** $21.50 per hour

**Expected hours:** 20- 25 per week

**Schedule:** After School Monday to Friday

**Experience:** After-school Program: 2 years (Required)

**Language:** Bilingual (Required) English and Spanish

**Ability to Commute:** New York, NY 10033 (Required) Work Location: In person

**Full job description overview:**

Activity Specialists will facilitate and lead various activities in STEM, arts, and physical recreation. Specialists will be asked to develop and execute lesson plans in their respective specialized enrichment activities. They are also expected to ensure a safe recreational environment for our scholars by exercising classroom management principles. Specialists will work closely with their group leaders, counselors, and the Program Director to connect

after-school learning opportunities to the real world through trips, take-home projects, and other activities. Specialists are expected to align with the school-day culture of discipline and community by upholding school-day rules and regulations and adhering to any staff regulations. Activity Specialists must be available to work 2 PM to 6:30 PM Monday through Friday, as well as 9-5 PM on days when there is no school for Holiday camp programming.

To create this kind of vibrant learning community, we invest in our faculty by providing ongoing professional training and support and encourage our educators to collaborate closely and push each other to achieve great outcomes.

**Responsibilities:**

Activity Specialists will be responsible for developing lesson plans and executing their specialized enrichment whether it’s STEM, arts, physical recreation, or youth development activities. Additionally, Specialists will:

* Serve as a role model/mentor to our students.
* Create and present a product list of any consumable supplies or equipment necessary for their activity.
* Maintain a safe, orderly, and joyful environment that supports strong program outcomes.
* Set up and break down any equipment used during your activity and maintain a clean and orderly workspace.
* Work collaboratively with the counselors, group leaders, program director, School staff, community partners, and others to achieve activity and program goals.
* Plan and organize off-site trips and activities that support the real-world application of your enrichment activity.
* Help monitor student participation, skill development, and program quality through a student information system.
* Activity Specialists report to the Program Director and Assistant Director.

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma, with some college preferred; current college and graduate students are strongly encouraged to apply
* At least 2 years of professional experience leading respected enrichment activity
* Experience working with middle school-aged populations is preferred
* Expertise or experience planning activities in the areas of arts, STEM, or physical recreation is preferred
* Strong leadership and team-building skills
* Strong group management skills
* Insistence on behavioral and academic excellence and rigor at all times
* Excellent interpersonal and problem-solving skills
* Strong professional relationships, ability to function in a team of people with diverse backgrounds and skills
* A hunger for feedback and an openness to engage in a process of self-improvement

**Looking for people specializing in Dance, Fashion, Culinary, and literacy (Creative Writing) among others.**

**If you are interested in this position Please submit your resume to jmartinez@ccmnyc.org Or jtaveras@ccmnyc.org**

CCM does not discriminate and is committed to making all personnel decisions without regard to any of the following: race; color; religion; creed; sex; gender (including gender identity and gender expression); sexual orientation; age; national origin; marital status; citizenship; disability; veteran or military status; genetic predisposition or carrier status; status as a victim of domestic violence, sex offenses or stalking; or any other protected characteristic as established by law. Our policy of Equal Employment Opportunity applies to all policies and procedures relating to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, termination and all other terms and conditions of employment.

title: Night Guest Laundry Attend-PT-102020
description:
**POSITION PURPOSE AND SUMMARY**
The Night Guest Laundry Attendant ("NGLA") position must demonstrate and promote a strong commitment to providing the best possible experience for our guests. The NGLA is responsible for assisting guests overnight, including checking in and checking guests out in accordance with company guidelines and procedures. The NGLA is responsible for completing all laundry responsibilities, answering phones, and ensuring that safety and security procedures are in place in accordance with company guidelines and standards.


Watch **A Day in the Life** video for Night Guest Laundry Attendant, https://vimeo.com/showcase/5180017/video/347336392


**MAJOR / KEY JOB DUTIES**


* Demonstrates and promotes a 100% commitment to providing the best possible experience for our guests and associates.
* Job function to include assisting guests overnight, checking in and checking guests out in accordance with company guidelines and procedures.
* Job functions to include processing all laundry in compliance with company standards. This includes but is not limited to treating for stains, washing, drying and folding linens, terry, blankets, bedspreads, mattresspads and shower curtains.
* Job functions to include processing all dishware in compliance with company standards. This includes but is not limited to washing, drying and packaging.
* Job function to include stocking all housekeeping carts, cart rooms and laundry with appropriate product to ensure that PAR levels are maintained through the entire building, in compliance with company standards.
* Must be able to process reservations, registration, payment, and departures in accordance with company guidelines and procedures.
* Job function to include setting up and maintaining the grab and go breakfast in accordance with company standards.
* Job function to include periodic daily tours of the property to inspect for cleanliness and maintenance in accordance with standards.
* Compliance with all company policies and procedures, including but not limited to the prompt reporting of all safety and security issues directly to the manager or to the appropriate authorities.

**OTHER DUTIES**


* Assists with the cleaning of any areas of the hotel as assigned by the manager when needed to include but not limited to front desk, associate breakroom, guest laundry, fitness room, vending areas, stairwells and common areas.
* Responsible for maintaining overall hotel cleanliness.
* And any other duties as requested by the management team.

title: Buyer
description:
**Job Summary**


The **Buyer** coordinates and executes less complex purchasing transactions under general supervision. Activities include place and confirm purchase orders with approved suppliers for established materials, parts, or services in accordance with contracts and production schedule. Responsible for expediting and problem resolution as required as well as and handling and resolving documentation discrepancies, procurement clerical issues and correspondence.

**Essential Functions**

* Negotiates and procures less complex and simple materials, supplies and equipment based on requirements.
* Locates new sources of supply when necessary to achieve optimal cost, delivery, and quality, to align with corporate goals and terms and conditions.
* Generates Supplier Activation, Reactivation or Inactive form and submits to Quality for production items.
* Maintains Supplier contact information, address, etc.
* Generates Supplier Survey for those suppliers that have relocated, as required.
* Maintain purchase orders and other required documents to ensure compliance.
* May set up outside services for manufactured parts.
* Works with Suppliers, Receiving and Accounting to Resolve Invoice issues.
* Processes documentation for Manufactured Parts (e.g. Certifications/Material Mill Certifications/First Article Inspection Reports, etc.)
* Guides and assists Expeditor to follow up with suppliers to improve or confirm expected delivery dates.
* Works with the supplier rejections to ensure corrective actions are taken and corrected.
* Other departmental duties as required

**Qualifications/Minimum requirements**

* High School Diploma, GED or relevant vocational training preferred.
* Minimum 3 years Buyer experience preferred.
* Minimum 2 years' Experience in Manufacturing setting preferred.
* Knowledge of ERP systems preferred.
* Preferred background in dealing with aerospace requirements (industry experience).
* U.S. Citizenship Required.
* Ability to read, write, and speak in English proficiently.
* Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook knowledge.

**Job Title:** Buyer

**Reports To:** Strategic Sourcing Manager

**Job Type:** Full time

**FLSA Classification:** Non-exempt (hourly)

**Salary Range:** $30 to $36 per hour. This estimated range represents a good faith projection of what we believe is a competitive compensation range for this position. Please understand that the offered salary will be determined based on factors such as the applicant's credentials, experiences, and the specific requirements of the role, as well as potential internal equity and external market considerations. We do not customarily hire at the top end of the range. East/West adheres to pay transparency and equity principles and strives to remain competitive within the market. We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds and experiences to apply. The full compensation package will be shared and discussed during the hiring process. In addition to the base salary, East/West is committed to supporting our team's well-being and professional growth through a comprehensive benefits package. This generous benefits package, includes but is not limited to:

* Medical, Dental, Vision

title: Human Resources Generalist/Payroll
description:
Elevate your HR career with **11 Howard,** where innovation meets opportunity!

As our HR Generalist/Paymaster, you'll thrive in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment that is about creativity, connection, and a healthy work-life balance.

Join a team as passionate and forward-thinking as you are and make your mark in the exciting world of hospitality.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Leave Management:** Handle all FMLA, PFL, Short-term disability, and worker's compensation forms with precision. Keep track of employees on leave and coordinate with management to ensure smooth operations.
* **Recruitment & Onboarding:** Manage the end-to-end hourly candidate recruitment process, including phone screenings, criminal background checks, employment verifications, and onboarding of new hires.
* **Offboarding:** Oversee the offboarding process, ensuring smooth transitions and accurate updates in payroll and HR systems.
* **Reporting:** Complete monthly reports and ensure compliance with Collective Bargaining requirements, including tracking anniversaries for rate adjustments.
* **Employee Relations:** Coordinate and promote employee relations events, recognition programs, and milestones such as birthdays and anniversaries.
* **Payroll Administration:** Process payroll from review to finalization. Ensure accurate PTO accrual and timely execution of pay rate changes.
* **HR Administration:** Maintain up-to-date employee data in ADP, process benefit changes, and ensure personnel and medical files are securely uploaded to our cloud platform.
* **Creative Communication:** Develop on-brand announcements, fliers, and promotional materials that engage our team and reflect our hotel's unique identity.
* **Employee Support:** Respond accurately to employee inquiries regarding payroll, benefits, and HR policies.

**Why This Role is For You:**

* You're creative and love crafting announcements and fliers that align with our brand.
* You have a natural ability to connect with people and foster positive relationships.
* You're flexible and willing to occasionally work early mornings, late nights, weekends, and holidays.
* You're eager to grow your career in HR, particularly within the hospitality industry.
* You value a healthy work-life balance and are excited to be part of an entrepreneurial work environment that encourages innovation and personal growth.

**What We Offer:**

* **Exceptional Work-Life Balance:** We believe in a healthy balance between work and personal life, ensuring our team is productive and fulfilled.
* **Comprehensive Benefits:** Enjoy a robust benefits package, including health insurance, retirement plans, and more, tailored to support your well-being and professional development.

**Join Us:** This role is excellent for someone who is organized, creative, and looking to make a meaningful impact in HR within the hospitality industry. If you're ready to take the next step in your career and be part of a dynamic team that values innovation, balance, and growth, we'd love to hear from you!

**Apply today at Careers@11howard.com to join our team.**
