title: Verizon Sales Representative
description:
Are you someone with a passion for providing first-rate customer experiences? We’re actively seeking top talent to join our Long Island-based team and become an integral component to our telecommunications program rollout.

We are known for providing stellar customer service to brands while simultaneously creating a company culture that puts employees' wellness first. We are looking for a driven, communications-obsessed Verizon Sales Representative who possesses the desire to set the standard in customer service and sales by going above and beyond for our clients in the telecommunications industry. Our team utilizes direct communication methods in order to deliver superior customer service and sales support on behalf of our clients.

Our team of customer service professionals are experts in building rapport and creating long-lasting customer satisfaction. Due to recent growth and market acquisition, we’re actively hiring a Verizon Sales Representative to join our Long Island-based team. The Verizon Sales Representative will become part of an exciting, inclusive culture that fosters productivity, creativity, and results. Our management is dedicated to providing our employees with a safe, team-oriented environment. What we do is just as important as how we do it.

**Our Verizon Sales Representative’s Primary Responsibilities:**

* Assist customers directly with filling out applications and submitting sales orders for wireless products
* Meet one-on-one with prospective customers to review their wants and needs and provide tailored product recommendations to meet those needs
* Handle customer questions, concerns, or complaints with a high level of professionalism and provide quality sales solutions
* Capitalize all opportunities to increase sales and revenue for the company by educating potential customers about our sales products and services
* Follow standard operating procedures and compliance policies as dictated by the company and client such as proper use of electronic devices, sales systems, and customer information
* Participate in team training with the Sales Associate team intended to improve customer satisfaction and business sales performance
* Maintain a working knowledge of company products, services, and packages and become an expert on client product knowledge

**Key Requirements for a Verizon Sales Representative:** 

* 1-2 years of customer service or sales associate experience preferred
* Highschool diploma or equivalent is ideal
* Ability to stand for long periods
* Ability to establish rapport with customers in a fast-paced environment
* Exhibits active listening skills by being engaged in sales conversations
* A driven individual who is adaptable and looking for a challenge
* Consistent and predictable attendance
* Must be team-oriented, articulate, and have a friendly personality
* Posses a student mentality, eager to learn and develop

**Company Perks For Our Verizon Sales Representative Team:**

* One-on-one training to foster continuous professional development with an assigned mentor
* In-person networking opportunities with top customer service and sales executives across the country
* A supportive environment with weekly reviews to discuss your personal and professional goals
* Company-funded events and travel opportunities such as bowling, amusement parks, tree planting, and regional conferences
* National holidays off!
* Regular bonuses and incentives from clientele based on market growth and capital
* 401K and health benefits that kick in with advancement opportunities

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Ability to Relocate:

* Jamaica, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: K-5 SEL & Mental Health Program Facilitator
description:
**Job Overview:**

Erin Pompa LLC is seeking passionate and experienced Facilitators that have experience working with grades K-5, a background in Dance, the Arts, SEL and Mental Heath to deliver innovative and engaging programming to Public Schools. Facilitators will be responsible for implementing a creative movement curriculum for grades K-3 and a mental health-focused arts curriculum for grades 4-5. These programs integrate social and emotional learning (SEL) with dance and arts to promote students' self-awareness, emotional intelligence, and overall well-being. Facilitators will also undergo professional training to align with program objectives.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Program Delivery:**

* Facilitate **Character Move** sessions for grades K-3, focusing on integrating creative movement with SEL principles across 10 sessions per class.
* Facilitate **Becoming a Mental Health Warrior** sessions for grades 4-5, using dance, writing, and art to promote mental health awareness and resilience across 10 sessions per class.
* Implement activities that encourage self-expression, emotional regulation, and positive social interactions among students.
* Lead students in creating and performing group projects that reflect their learning and personal growth.

**Training & Development:**

* Participate in approximately 10 hours of training at $20 per hour to prepare for program delivery and align with the curriculum’s goals and methodologies.
* Engage in ongoing professional development to stay updated on best practices in SEL, arts integration, and student engagement.

**Classroom Management:**

* Dynamic and captivating with students and in the classroom.
* Manage classroom dynamics effectively to ensure a supportive and inclusive learning environment.
* Adapt instruction to meet the diverse needs of students, including those with different learning styles and abilities.
* Collaborate with program director to schedule and plan sessions according to the proposed schedule.

**Student Engagement & Support:**

* Foster a positive and empathetic relationship with students, encouraging their participation and creativity.
* Support students in developing self-awareness, resilience, and social skills through guided activities and discussions.
* Provide feedback and encouragement to students, helping them reflect on their progress and set goals for improvement.

**Qualifications:**

**Education & Experience:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Dance, Arts, Education, or a related field is preferred.
* Experience in K-12 education, particularly within dance and arts, is highly desirable.
* Experience in delivering programs that integrate SEL or mental health education is a plus.

**Skills & Competencies:**

* Strong understanding of social and emotional learning (SEL) principles and their application in a classroom setting.
* Proficiency in dance, creative movement, and/or visual arts, writing, music, etc...
* Excellent classroom management skills with the ability to engage young learners in creative activities.
* Effective communication skills for interacting with students, school staff, and parents.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

**Personal Attributes:**

* Passion for education and a commitment to fostering students' emotional and creative development.
* Creativity and enthusiasm in developing and delivering engaging curriculum content.
* Flexibility and adaptability to meet the needs of a dynamic classroom environment.

**Compensation:**

* **Rate for Facilitation:** $35 - $40 per class session, approximately 15 sessions.
* **Rate for Training:** $20 - $30 per hour, approximately 10 hours of training.

**Schedule:**

* Start approx. 3rd week in Sept. 2024.
* Schedule and Position Pending Proposal Approval.

**Application Process:**

Interested candidates should submit a resume and cover letter.

**Erin Pompa LLC is an equal opportunity contractor. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all facilitators.**

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $35.00 - $40.00 per hour

Expected hours: 7 – 15 per week

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Paterson, NJ (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Fish Host
description:
Stew Leonard’s, a family-owned and operated fresh food store founded in 1969, has locations in Connecticut, New York, and New Jersey. Stew’s earned its nickname, the “Disneyland of Dairy Stores” because of its country-fair atmosphere, with costumed characters and animated entertainment throughout the store that keep children entertained while parents shop.
  
  

Fish Host
  
**Position Type:** Part-Time
  
**Location:** Paramus, NJ
  
**Pay:** $16 - $16.15 per hour – paid weekly
  
**Shift and Schedule:** Mornings, Afternoons, Evenings, Weekends, Holidays
  
**Age Requirements:** Must be 18 years or older
  
  

**Position Description:**  

Host/Hostesses interact directly with customers at the service bars and aid by answering specific product questions, offering recommendations, packaging, and pricing products ordered by customers at the service bar.
  
  

**Your day-to-day:**  

* Assisting customers with fish selection
* Maintaining a clean and safe workstation
* Providing customers with exceptional customer service
* Maintaining the department's needs each day


,
  
  

**What you bring to the team:**  

* An enthusiastic personality
* Excellent customer service
* Being able to follow all health, sanitation, and safety regulations
* Entry level, no prior experience required
* Great oral communication
* Personable Characteristic
* Self-motivator


**Working Conditions:**  

* The temperature in the department is colder than room temperature due to the products being highly perishable
* The position requires frequent walking, standing, lifting, pushing and pulling with a maximum of 75lbs and occasionally climbing and reaching


Why you’ll love working here!
  
  

**Family Oriented:** We respect the personal balance between work and family with career opportunity and growth- over 80% of our managers have been promoted from within.
  
  

**Benefits:** High value, high quality Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage, 401 K plan for FT & PT team members, family & personal time, life insurance, and more!
  
  

**Environment:** Have you seen the Avocado Girls? Chiquita Banana? Or the singing Parrot?
  
  

**Pay Day:** We’re thrilled to offer our employees Dayforce Wallet – a new way to get paid. Say bye-bye to pay day and hello to pay your way. Get your pay as soon as you earn it, at no cost to you – It’s your money, why should you wait? Request your pay as you earn it.
  
  

We take pride in the power of diversity, inclusion, and being socially responsible to the communities in which we live and do business
  
  

Apply today and start as soon as 1 week!
  
  

For more information on working at Stew Leonard’s, click the link below!
  
http://www.stewleonards.com/work-at-stews/
  
  

Stew Leonard's is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation or national origin.

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
Since opening our doors, we have been characterized by our ability to persevere, adapt, transcend, and take risks. Our dedication to our customers, employees, and clients is unmatched and has only intensified over the years. We value camaraderie, respect, and inclusivity amongst our Customer Service Representative team and company as a whole. These values are what distinguish us from every other firm.

As the Customer Service Representative, you will determine eligibility, process orders successfully, and build reliable, trusting relationships with those wishing to move forward with the products and services recommended. At the heart of every interaction, we aim to provide a level of service that goes well beyond our customer's expectations. We firmly believe that all customers should feel heard and appreciated. The same goes for our employees, which is why we support all of our Customer Service Representatives professionally and personally. We have our eyes set on finding a determined Customer Service Representative to grow infinitely within our firm.

**To Nail The Customer Service Representative Position You Must:**

* Understand each consumer needs and tailor unique solutions reinforcing the benefits of our service, product offerings, and enrollment process
* Recommend potential products or services to management by collecting customer information and analyzing customer needs
* Contribute to team effort by accomplishing office results as needed
* Building customer loyalty through exceptional listening, consultative relationship building, resourcefulness, and comprehensive knowledge of our client's services
* Communicate with customers with a high level of empathy and sincerity and process orders quickly and efficiently
* Use provided resources and customer service tactics to identify custom solutions and anticipate customer needs in our commitment to maintaining the first point of contact resolution
* Meet and exceed performance standards set by Senior Management that include customer survey results, sales rates, quality goals, compliance regulations, and productivity targets

**We'll Be Looking For Our Customer Service Representative To Have:**

* Minimum of high school diploma or equivalent is ideal
* Proven success in customer service, sales, client facing, and consultative sales environment
* Ability to work cohesively with the Customer Service Representative team to achieve common targets
* Passion for people and developing genuine relationships
* Enjoys a fast-paced (fun) working environment
* Reliable and able to work flexible full-time hours
* Innovative, professional with customers, mindful, and empathetic

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $41,480.57 - $53,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: In person

title: Care Coordinator - Tarrytown
description:
Spear Physical and Occupational Therapy is seeking a qualified, passionate entry level Care Coordinator to join the team at our Tarrytown clinic.
  
Care Coordinators are responsible for supporting patient care by making our patients feel welcomed and valued whilst also controlling the flow of the appointment. Care Coordinators are expected to respond to all phone calls and emails within 2 hours and always within 24hours. Care Coordinators will guide our patients through our out-of-network experience and greet all patients who enter the clinic with a smile. Care Coordinators are expected to execute 5-star customer service. Spear strives to foster a true community environment for both patients and team members; therefore, a collaborative spirit is valued to ensure everyone receives the care and support they need.
  
  

**QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* Previous customer service experience.
* Someone who is hospitable, welcoming, and team-orientated.
* Strong communication skills and ability to multi-task.
* A strong attention to detail and willingness to grow.
* BA.BS degree preferred, not required.


**WHAT WE OFFER:**  

We know that exceptional patient service can only be achieved when our team is well cared for.
  
We strive to create an environment that bolsters career growth while providing the flexibility and
  
time necessary to simply be a human being. Further benefits include:
  
* One Medical paid membership. Learn more at onemedical.com/business
* Mental Health benefits that include paid time off and support services through Journey Live & employer sponsored EAP program.
* Medical, Dental, Vision Benefits, Commuter FSA Plan.
* 401(K) Safe Harbor Match: SPEAR will make a matching contribution equal to 100% of the first 3% of annual compensation, plus 50% of the next 2% of annual compensation. The total SPEAR matching contribution will not exceed 4% of your annual compensation
* Generous paid time including PTO, Floating Holidays, Company Holidays, Mental Health
* Commuter FSA Plans – pretax savings plans for travel to & from work
* Employee Perks: discounted rates for entertainment, travel, fitness, insurance plans, etc. Gym membership discounts with Blink & Crunch Fitness.
* Company Events - Annual Summer Picnic and Holiday Awards Celebration


**SALARY:** $16 - $22 / hr
  
  

**WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:**  

We value empathy in our team members and a dedication to clinical excellence -- whatever your workstyle -- above all else. While we are looking for both entrepreneurial big-thinkers and those dedicated simply to the day-to-day of treatment, successful candidates will understand that being clear is kind and that actions express priorities. No matter where you are in your career, we are positive you will find your niche with us and grow.
  
  

**Further success factors may include:**  

* Passion for the field hospitality and customer service.
* Self-motivation and willingness to go above and beyond.
* Enjoyment of seeking out an opportunity to make an impact daily and connecting with people.
* A proactive, collaborative, team-oriented attitude because we don’t work in silos.
* You celebrate wins and learn from losses with your patients, colleagues, and surrounding communities.
* A resonance with our SPEAR-IT values:
* Service
* Passion
* Empathy
* Accountability
* Respect
* Impact
* Teamwork


**ABOUT US:**  

Spear Physical and Occupational Therapy is the nation’s leading outpatient practice. With more than 50 clinics in the New York Tri-State Area and 25 years of experience, Spear provides unprecedented patient access to physical and occupational therapy through its robust list of services covered by most major insurances. Since its founding, Spear has been honored by some of the top medical, academic, and business communities. Among these accolades, they have twice been named the nation’s top physical therapy practice by the American Physical Therapy Association and WebPT, received the Columbia Award for Leadership in Clinical Education, served as official therapists to Olympic teams and Broadway shows, and been featured for their expertise in The New York Times, CBS News, Good Morning America, The Today Show, and more. Learn more about Spear’s history of excellence at spearcenter.com.
company_description: Every member of the Spear team is integral to the practice, and guided toward achieving his/her personal best.

title: Cocinero de linea
description:
*Convene is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and we believe that diverse teams are the best teams. We live our values of GRIT (Genuine, Relentless, Integrity & Teamwork) and strive to create an inclusive and equitable workplace where everyone can be their true selves, where we all show up for each other. In line with our goal to be 1% better every day, we are committed to listening, learning, growing and improving. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives to join us on this journey.*

Convene is seeking a Line Cook to join our Culinary Team who has a strong passion for food, culinary technique, and is eager to learn more and build on their skills in a high-end setting. The ideal candidate is friendly, curious, and dedicated to becoming an integral member of a team that values hard work and attention to detail. This position works as part of a robust operations team and reports directly to the Executive Chef.

Our employees carry out our Core Values every day: Genuine, Relentless, Integrity, and Teamwork.

This full time role requires an early morning start and pays $21/hour with overtime eligibility.

**What You’ll Do:**

As a Cook, you will be responsible for preparing, cooking, and serving daily menu items to the clients in Convene locations. Cooks carry out all responsibilities while maintaining food handling, safety and sanitation standards.

* Effectively participate in our professionally run daily food service exemplifying excellence in portioning, cooking, timing, plate assembly, and communication
* Prepare, cook, and serve items, while adhering to the recipes and ensuring high quality and visual presentation of food
* Prepare and deliver catering orders that are placed for our meeting and event clients with precision and punctuality
* Assist other associates to ensure all kitchen duties are completed within the given time constraints
* Ensure all proper steps of service are followed in accordance with Convene standards
* Responsible for constant sanitation, organization and proper food handling

**What We Look For:** 

* Minimum 1 year Cook experience in a related role
* Strong cooking and knife skills required
* Positive and enthusiastic approach to all assignments
* Ability to work well with others and have good communication skills
* Cheerful, presentable, and helpful when dealing with customers
* Flexible and long hours are sometimes required; rotating work schedule that may include nights and weekends
* Move, lift, carry, push, pull and place objects weighing less than or equal to 25 pounds without assistance
* Reach overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping
* Ability to stand, sit, or walk for an extended period of time

**Compensation:** 

The above job definition information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Job duties and responsibilities are subject to change based on changing business needs and conditions.

Full Time Hourly Rate: $21.00/hour

This role is also eligible for Convene's annual incentive performance bonus plan.

This information reflects the anticipated base salary range for this position based on current national data. Minimums and maximums may vary based on location. Individual pay is based on skills, experience and other relevant factors.

**Who We Are:**

Convene is a global lifestyle hospitality company that designs and operates premium meeting, event, and flexible office spaces. It is the largest single provider of dedicated meeting and event venues in North America and the UK with a network of 39 locations across nine cities; Convene’s portfolio of brands includes etc.venues, Club 75, and the “by Convene” label for bespoke locations in partnership with other organizations. With a combined 44 years of experience, Convene brands bring hospitality and lifestyle into traditional commercial real estate assets, partnering with the industry’s top landlords to deliver increased building value while also creating premium experiences for tenants. The company counts Ares, RXR Realty, and Hudson’s Bay Company among its investors, and has been named one of America’s 100 Most Promising Companies by *Forbes* and a Best Workplace by *Inc.* magazine, *Fortune* magazine, and *Built In*. Learn more at https://convene.com/.

**We’re Here For You:**

At Convene, you’ll receive:

* Excellent health coverage for you and your family starting day one
* Medical and insurance navigation support through Eden Health
* Flexible vacation time plus time off for your birthday
* A Holiday closure each year to allow all employees to unplug and recharge
* 401K plan with company matching
* Professional development support
* A chance to be part of a dynamic, growing team
* The opportunity to have a significant impact on your team and the business in the work that you do
* A culture of GRIT (Genuine, Relentless, Integrity and Teamwork)

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $21.00 per hour

Expected hours: 35 – 50 per week

Shift:

* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Morning shift

Work Location: In person

Properties located in the following US cities: Boston, Chicago, Philadelphia, Washington, DC, New York City. 
International Property in London, UK. Opening in San Francisco, CA in 2023.

title: Sommelier/Manager
description:
New to be opened Tablecloth Italian Steakhouse in Morristown NJ is seeking a skilled

Sommelier to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for wine and exceptional customer service skills. As a Sommelier, you will be responsible for curating wine lists, providing recommendations, and enhancing the overall dining experience for our guests.

- Manage wine inventory and storage

- Sommelier should also have management experience as you may be required to help the restaurant and General Manager with other duties

- Previous experience in a fine dining or catering environment  
- Strong knowledge of different types of wines, regions, and vintages. Concentrating in Italian wines  
- Excellent customer service skills  
- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment  
- Certification from a recognized sommelier program is a plus  
- Knowledge of menu planning and meal preparation techniques  
- Familiarity with cash register operations and sales processes

title: Program Director
description:
**Train & Earn Program Director/EO-WIOA Liaison**

Workforce Development & Continuing Education

Status: Full time, Exempt

**Annual Salary:** $58,000 - $60,000 - commensurate with education and experience.

**Benefits:** 

· Paid time off

· Pension

· Health insurance

· Life insurance

· Dental insurance

· Vision insurance

· Flexible spending accounts

· 403 (b) retirement plan with agency match

· Professional development assistance

· Employee Assistance Program

· Employee Discount

· Great work environment

**The Mosholu Montefiore Community Center (MMCC)** is the largest not-for-profit provider of quality education, employment, and health and recreation programs in the impoverished neighborhoods of the North Bronx, serving the needs of more than 35,000 residents each year. Since our founding as a neighborhood community center in 1942, MMCC has served the needs of thousands of neighbors from all cultural backgrounds, religions, races, ethnicities, sexual orientations and special needs.

The mission of MMCC is to improve the lives of Bronx and Manhattan residents with our dedication to humanitarian efforts; reaching out to a rich tapestry of cultures, building gateways to success through quality service and programs, building confidence, sustainability and working toward self-sufficiency for the individuals we serve.

**Job Description/Responsibilities:** 

* Ensure a welcoming environment in assigned Educational Counseling Center Programs.
* Develop, implement, and achieve enrollment goals identified in programs.
* Coordinate with program staff on attainment, recruitment, Intake, selection, retention, and all projects related to the program.
* Manage day to day operation by analyzing program data, tracking program attendance, mentoring relationships and academic/other performance for youth and mentors.
* Develop program marketing plan including mailings, advertisements, and community outreach.
* Oversee and conduct ongoing program member evaluations and surveys to ensure that high levels of quality in programs are always maintained; ensure outcomes align with the needs of the community and the Agency and funders' strategic plan.
* Ensure programs operate in accordance with Federal, State, and local requirements, funders' requirements and MMCC's Best Practices.
* Prepare for all program audits (Internal and external) and review recommendations for implementation.
* Recruit and hire staff using screening tools and panel Interview to gain the best possible fit with each opening.
* Identify program volunteer positions and assist with the identification, recruitment and tracking of program volunteers.
* Provide direct supervision to program staff, assuring that staff are qualified, certified and are meeting performance standards for their position.
* Provide training for staff and volunteers on an ongoing basis through staff meetings and workshops.
* Monitors and approves all payroll.
* Ensure all staff members are familiar with programs offered at MMCC so staff can inform clients about MMCC programs that will meet members' changing needs and Interests.
* Adhere to the Non-discrimination and Equal Opportunity provisions for Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (WIOA) (29 CFR Part 38).
* Attend all required meetings/trainings regarding EO-WIOA.
* Review agency's written policies to make sure policies are nondiscriminatory.
* Comply with Section 188/Americans with Disability Act and Section 504.
* Act as the liaison to DYCD/ACCES-VR.
* Orientate staff/participants/linkages/partnerships/employers on the Non-discrimination and Equal Opportunity provisions for WIOA, which include, but are not limited, to the following:
* Reasonable Accommodations Policies and Procedures
* Grievance Policies and Procedures
* Discrimination Complaint Policies and Procedures
* Complete and submit all required documents in a professional & timely manner, which include, but are not limited to the following:
* Training Tracking form
* WIOA Interagency Release of Information Form (if applicable)
* Discrimination Complaint Log to be submitted to DYCD quarterly.
* Issue, review, and obtain signature on the Notice of Rights Acknowledgment Bulletin (NORAB) for staff/participants/linkages/partnerships/employers, maintaining NORAB with original signature on file.
* Share ACCES-VR User Friendly Guide with all participants/employees.
* Complete the DYCD/ACCESVR Checklist, if applicable.
* Prominently post all required postings.
* Publicize the contact information for designated EO/ACCES-VR liaison, staff who handles complaints and staff who has access to confidential files.
* Ensure that DYCD has accurate and up to date information in a timely manner. Conduct outreach and education about equal opportunity and nondiscrimination requirements consistent with 29 CFR 38.40 and how an individual may file a complaint consistent with 29 CFR 38.69.
* Ensure that the DYCD approved LEP Plan/Babel Notice is shared with participants & employees.
* Oversee the implementation of the LEP Plan.
* All other related duties as it pertains to managing programs.

**Required Competencies:**

The Program Director will serve as the primary liaison to DYCD, oversee key program staff, be responsible for administrative deliverables, and lead quality, day-to-day program operations. The director will have at least:

· This position requires a BA or BS degree and two years pf relevant experience or five years of relevant experience and a two-year degree.

· Some evenings and occasional weekends as required for program implementation.

· Must understand utilization of community resources.

· Must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills.

· Must provide quality internal and external community service; demonstrate good judgement in dealing with issues; be solutions oriented.

· Must have the ability to work independently with attention to task details and meeting deadlines.

· Leadership competencies for program stakeholders.

· Persistent/resilient, flexible, and able to multi-task; demonstrate good time management skills.

· Be team oriented.

· Proficient in basic use of a computer including Microsoft Office, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Google Suite.

**Annual Salary:** $58,000 - $60,000 - commensurate with education and experience.

**Work Schedule:** Monday to Friday, daytime, 8-hour shift

**To Apply:** 

Interested candidates please submit resumes and cover letters to Yuisa Santiago at ysantiago@mmcc.org

Auxiliary aids and services are available upon request for individuals with disabilities. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristics protected by the applicable law.**

title: Program Manager, Person-Centered Care (Administrator Funded Project - Level 1), Planetree Program - Quality & Safety/South Brooklyn Health **Grant Funded**
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


**Empower Every New Yorker — Without Exception — to Live the Healthiest Life Possible**


NYC Health + Hospitals is the largest public health care system in the United States. We provide essential outpatient, inpatient and home-based services to more than one million New Yorkers every year across the city’s five boroughs. Our large health system consists of ambulatory centers, acute care centers, post-acute care/long-term care, rehabilitation programs, Home Care, and Correctional Health Services. Our diverse workforce is uniquely focused on empowering New Yorkers, without exception, to live the healthiest life possible.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


This position will manage and direct programs related to the philosophy of Person-Centered Care [PCC]\\* across the system. The incumbent will be involved with assessment, data analysis, and strategic planning to improve the employee and patient experiences. They will report to and work closely with the Care Experience leader at their respective facility/service line, peer incumbents at other locations in the health system, as well as the Central Office Care Experience and Workforce Wellness departments. This role will partner with all key stakeholders from executive leadership to front-line staff, patients/residents/community members to spearhead improvement effort initiatives within the organization.

* Person-Centered Care (PCC) is care focused on the needs of individuals, guided by peoples’ preferences and values, and includes supporting structures, policies, and practices that create a culture of quality, compassion, and partnership across the continuum of care.
* Develop, implement, and evaluate person-centered initiatives to enhance care quality and experience, including workflow design, performance improvement, and training
* Co-design and promote patient-inclusive performance improvement projects
* Utilize evidence=based methods to enhance healthcare experiences through compassionate, person-centered techniques including partnerships, improvement planning and solution generation in support of the theme “Nothing for me without me”
* Create sustainment plans to address gaps identified through prior and ongoing assessments of lived healthcare experiences
* Support and build a peer-based model to adopt and adapt person-centered principles across the health system
* Foster organization-wide partnerships to develop, and deploy recognition programs
* Implement best practices in person-centered care to be sustained and scaled at certified sites, and spread and scale to non-certified sites within the health system
* Partner with Patient Safety, Workforce Wellness, Human Resources, and Care Experience teams to analyze, and share Employee Feedback Survey results
* Serve as expert and resource to aid employee engagement action planning and improvement efforts
* Co-lead Patient-Family Advisory/Partnership Committee (PFAC/PFPC) to inform organizational improvements in patient experience
* Spearhead workgroups to develop and sustain person-centered care cultural efforts, as well as align existing experience programs and initiatives with person-centered care framework and philosophy
* Develop person-centered care goals and outcomes to align with organizational strategy
* Utilize available measurement approaches to evaluate the success and effectiveness of person-centered programs
* Design and implement policies and initiatives endorsing person-centered care practices
* Serve as a role model and champion for person-centered behaviors and standards with kindness and a service excellence mindset
* Perform additional duties as required


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


Educational and/or experience requirements will vary requiring diverse kinds and levels depending on the content, complexity and variety of project. Compensation levels will correspond to the requirements developed for the designated project.  

In no event will the acceptable minimum be below:  

1. A Baccalaureate Degree from an accredited college or university in a specialization discipline consistent with project content; and,  

2. Four years of substitutable and relevant health care experience related to the objectives of the project; or,  

3. A satisfactory equivalent combination of experience, training and education.


**Department Preferences**
--------------------------



* Master's degree in hospitality, healthcare, or a related field
* Bachelor's degree with 5 years of experience OR
* Master's with 3 years of experience
* Foundational knowledge of healthcare operations; understanding of HIPAA and other regulations designed to protect patient rights and confidentiality
* Prior background in the hospitality or related industry (hotels, travel, and tourism) exemplifying leading and best practices in customer service
* Experience with facilitating training programs and interventions focused on service excellence
* Proficient in Microsoft Office and Adobe suites of programs and applications
* Motivated self-starter with strong leadership, change management, planning, organizational and project management skills
* Excellent verbal, written, and facilitation skills to communicate with stakeholders at all organizational levels
* Ability to act as a change agent supporting organizational culture change and transformation
* Adept understanding of business principles, operations and process improvement strategy
* Strong interpersonal skills and ability to manage a multitude of activities in a fast-paced environment


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

*If applying online, please include your cover letter in the same file attachment with your uploaded resume.*


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs


**Vacancy Control Board Number**
--------------------------------

  


VCB #: OQS-08022024-29500

title: Wound Care Nurse RN - Full time
description:
Registered Nurse
  
  

At RestorixHealth, our mission is simple…to restore health and improve the quality of life – and access to care – for patients with wounds.
  
  

Our Wound Care Registered Nurses (will train) are the heart and soul behind what we do. Utilizing the Nursing Process, the RN plans, implements, directs, and evaluates patient care to achieve optimal outcomes. The Wound Care Nurse works collaboratively with all other disciplines on the assigned unit. Additionally, the RN prioritizes nursing actions and will implement physician orders accurately within appropriate time frames. Ongoing training will provide you with the tools to be successful in your role.
  
  

Take your passion for enhancing the lives of patients and turn it into a career, join the RestorixHealth Team and APPLY TODAY!
  
  

**What We Offer:**  

* Monday - Friday schedule, no weekends
* RestorixHealth is proud to provide employees with a comprehensive and attractive benefits program which includes the following:
* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
* Health Savings Account (with employer match) and Flexible Spending Accounts (General Purpose, Limited Purpose, and Dependent Care)
* Employer-Paid Basic Life Insurance, AD&D and Short-Term Disability
* Voluntary Buy-Up Life Insurance (for self, spouse & children), Short-Term Disability and Long-Term Disability
* Voluntary Accident, Critical Illness and Hospital Indemnity Plans
* Employee Assistance Program
* Pet Care Discount Program
* Generous Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays
* 401(k) Retirement Plan (with employer match)
* Internal ongoing educational/training opportunities
* Competitive compensation
* Continuous coaching & mentorship


**What You’ll Do:**  

* Provide patient care based on scientific principles/nursing theory and evidence-based practice
* Recognize change in the patient’s condition and intervene appropriately
* Prioritize nursing actions including reflecting patient needs, acuity, and desired outcomes
* Implement physician orders accurately within appropriate time frames
* Educate and counsel patients and their families on wound care processes and issues


**Qualifications:**  

* Associate degree in nursing, Bachelor of Science in Nursing required for Magnet Hospitals
* Valid Registered Nursing license required
* Valid CPR certification from the American Heart Association required
* Prior experience working with wound care patients (Will train)
* Prior experience with billing and coding preferred


At RestorixHealth, we grow talent. When you join our team, you have the opportunity to develop your career based on your strengths and potential, including the possibility to move functionally, geographically, laterally, and vertically. This is a career destination for engaged, caring, passionate and talented people who want to make a difference. We are the leader in the development and management of comprehensive wound healing and Amputation Prevention Center facilities.
  
  

RestorixHealth is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, or marital status.

title: Psychologist - Level I
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


Elmhurst Hospital Center (EHC) is the major tertiary care provider in the borough of Queens. The hospital is comprised of 545 beds and is a Level I Trauma Center, an Emergency Heart Care Station and a 911 Receiving Hospital. It is the premiere health care organization for key areas such as Surgery, Cardiology, Women's Health, Pediatrics, Rehabilitation Medicine, Renal and Mental Health Services.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


Elmhurst Hospital Center (EHC) is the major tertiary care provider in the borough of Queens. The hospital is comprised of 545 beds and is a Level I Trauma Center, an Emergency Heart Care Station and a 911 Receiving Hospital. It is the premiere health care organization for key areas such as Surgery, Cardiology, Women's Health, Pediatrics, Rehabilitation Medicine, Renal and Mental Health Services.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Work Shifts**
---------------

  


Rotating


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


This class of positions encompasses professional and/or supervisory work of varying degrees of difficulty in the field of psychology, providing psychological services to individuals and groups across various settings, including Forensic Psychiatric Evaluation Court Clinics (FPECC), which may include participation in the process of commitment of patients to institutional care. Ensures patient-centered quality care and services in support of better outcomes and improved patient experience, in accordance with all applicable local, state, and federal rules and regulations, and psychology standards of care. There are three (3) Assignment Levels within this class of positions; all personnel perform related work.


Assignment Level I


Under general supervision, with latitude for independent or unreviewed action or decision-making, performs professional work in the field of psychology. Unlicensed individuals must work under the supervision of a New York State licensed and currently registered Psychologist.


**Duties & Responsibilities**
-----------------------------

  


1. Through clinical interviewing and/or through the selection, administration and interpretation of standard group and individual tests of personality development and intellectual capacity, evaluates individuals' emotional and intellectual functioning.


2. Maintains suitable records and files of test performance and treatment results.


3. Prepares reports of psychological findings which may be included in clinical case histories, files, etc.


 4. Consults with psychiatrists, social workers, judges and other relevant parties regarding the diagnoses, prognoses and recommendations for disposition of individual cases.


5. Attends and may participate in psychological and general staff conferences.


6. Participates in individual and group research by evaluating initial summarization and quantitative treatment of data, preparing research reports for publication.


7. May be required to provide psychological consultation services on non-clinical issues, and may offer psychological consultation services to other City agencies.


8. May participate in treatment programs administering psychotherapy.


9. May provide neuro-psychological and vocational assessments.


10. May prepare commitment papers, including write-ups and documentation for cases.


11. May give instruction or training in psychodiagnostics and/or therapeutic techniques.


12. May oversee the work of psychology interns, social workers and paraprofessional mental health workers.


13. May do research on test development. May contribute to formulation of hypotheses and details of research design.


14. May be required to testify in court or at other hearings.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


For Appointment to Assignment Level I:


1. Doctoral degree (e.g., PhD, PsyD, EdD) in Psychology from an American Psychological Association (APA) accredited program, accepted by the NYSED.


2. Valid limited permit to practice as a Psychologist issued by the New York State Education Department (NYSED).


3. Valid license and current registration to practice as a Psychologist issued by the NYSED must be obtained within two (2) years of appointment to title.

title: VP, Legal, Employment
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***

**Who We Are…**

When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the *storytellers* bringing our characters to life, the *creators* bringing them to your living rooms and the *dreamers* creating what’s next…


From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.


Your New Role


This position provides employment legal support and counseling for P&C and business leaders within Warner Bros Discovery. The role is primarily focused on supporting WBD’s corporate business units and operations and may support other client groups and initiatives within the WBD’s global corporate functions and departments. This role works closely with the broader internal employment legal team to provide day-to-day advice and subject matter expertise across the full range of employee relations and other labor and employment issues across the US. In consultation with the international employment legal team, this role manages global initiatives and issues, including implementation of global policies. This role manages a team of paralegal and attorney staff, providing day to day management and strategic direction and prioritization. This role interprets the latest employment legislation and case law into practical, straight forward language to deliver workable solutions in a fast paced, dynamic global business environment. Delivers training on key legal matters within client groups.

  

Your Role Accountabilities

* Advice and counseling on labor and employment matters
* Support for corporate initiatives and projects as needed and assigned, including restructuring reviews, policies, and harmonization initiatives.
* Employment legal support for employment disputes and litigation, including administrative charges and arbitration proceedings
* Analyzes, drafts, negotiates employment-related agreements and provides legal support to WBD’s contract administration team.
* Management of a team that includes a lawyer and paralegal


Qualifications & Experience

* 12 years of experience as a practicing labor and employment lawyer
* Experience in a global environment, preferably in media
* Experience supervising or overseeing the work of other attorney(s)
* Juris Doctor
* Member of a state bar in good standing and eligible to practice as in-house counsel in New York or Georgia
* Knowledge of labor and employment law and the legal environment of the media industry sufficient to prepare legal documents, represent WBD in legal proceedings, and advise management
* Must be able to prepare, negotiate, and interpret complex agreements and other legal documents
* Must be able to research legal questions and to provide written and oral advice
* Must be able to supervise and evaluate legal, paralegal and administrative subordinates

**How We Get Things Done…**


This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

**Championing Inclusion at WBD**


Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.
If you’re a qualified candidate and you require adjustments or accommodations to search for a job opening or apply for a position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.
In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. Actual salaries will vary based on several factors, including but not limited to external market data, internal equity, location, skill set, experience, and/or performance. Base pay is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery’s total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $196,000.00 - $364,000.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and sick time and vacation.

title: Medicare Sales Representative I
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


MetroPlus**Health** provides the highest quality healthcare services to residents of Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens and Staten Island through a comprehensive list of products, including, but not limited to, New York State Medicaid Managed Care, Medicare, Child Health Plus, Exchange, Partnership in Care, MetroPlus Gold, Essential Plan, etc. As a wholly-owned subsidiary of NYC Health + Hospitals, the largest public health system in the United States, MetroPlus**Health** network includes over 27,000 primary care providers, specialists and participating clinics. For more than 30 years, MetroPlus has been committed to building strong relationships with its members and providers to enable New Yorkers to live their healthiest life.

 **Position Overview**


The Medicare Sales Representative provides greater access to health insurance, by providing education and assistance to Medicare individuals. The Medicare Sales Representative is involved with health education through the distribution of health ed. materials and arranging for health screenings. In addition, the Medicare Sales Representative provides Facilitated Enrollment, helps facilitate the continuance of health insurance, and offers assistance with recertification.


**Job Description**
-------------------



* Identify prospective enrollees and determine eligibility for participation in MetroPlusHealth’s Medicare product.
* Understand and apply all policies and procedure pertaining to:
	+ Disclosures and provisions of the MetroPlusHealth Medicare product.
	+ Enrollment and disenrollment.
* Conduct home visits, and personalized appointments as needed to complete the enrollment process.
* Market MetroPlusHealth Medicare line of business on-site at hospitals, senior centers, assisted living facilities, community events and other sites as designated.
* Understand the covered benefits, non-covered benefits, exclusions and exemptions.
* Educating enrollees on all aspects of the Plan, as well as answering questions regarding Plan’s features and benefits.
* Keep informed and adhere to current information pertaining to marketing activity guidelines set forth by various regulatory agencies—this includes providing enrollees with all corresponding materials and documentation.
* Complete applications and field reports such as Presumptive Eligibility reports, and personnel forms (time sheets, expense reports, etc.) in a timely and accurate manner.
* Work closely with the Outreach Representatives, Customer Service Representatives Eligibility Representatives and other MetroPlusHealth personnel to resolve member concerns regarding complaints and potential enrollments or disenrollment’s.
* Establish and maintain a positive working relationship with facility and site staff community and provider organizations, as well as City and State regulatory agencies.
* Assist members in accessing health care, transportation needs and other services or issues as they occur and pertain to members.
* Conduct and participate in telemarketing/outreach efforts as required.
* Develop a presence in the local community to help generate enrollments.
* Making presentations to large groups of seniors.
* Required to complete Annual Medicare Training


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------



* Must have a High School Diploma or equivalency; College Degree or coursework preferred
* 2-3 years of Sales/Customer Relations experience required
* Public speaking experience
* Medicare Sales experience preferred
* Bi-Lingual and Multi-Lingual a plus
* Must possess a valid NYS Life, Accident and Health License at the time of employment. License must remain valid at all times during employment with no lapse in coverage. Must maintain all required continuing education requirements and renew license in advance of its expiration.
* Valid NYS Driver’s License is a plus

**Professional Competencies**

* Integrity and Trust
* Customer Focus
* Functional/Technical skills
* Must be self-confident, an independent thinker, and maintain a professional presentation of self
* Must demonstrate flexibility and willingness to learn
* Excellent organizational, written, presentation, and communication skills
* Excellent problem-solving skills
* Highly motivated and goal directed
* Must be able to work in a multi-ethnic, multi-cultural environment
* Must be sensitive to chronic conditions and disabilities
company_description: We always put patients first! NYCHHC is committed to excellence in health care and the safety of people in the City of New York.

title: Site Manager
description:
**Job Title:** Site Operations Manager

  


**Summary/Objective**


The Site Operations Manager will oversee daily operations of the data center and ensure work is done safely, on time and within budget, and adhere to quality standards. The Site Manager will supervise and manage a team of 3-8 direct reports, including but not limited to Operations Technicians. They identify risks with each Data Center project, perform qualitative and quantitative risk analysis, and perform risk responses and control risks. Comply with OSHA standards related to Health and Safety in Data Center environment.

  


**Essential Functions**


* Plans, schedules, and coordinates the implementation and maintenance of data center / technical space critical facility infrastructure (power, cooling, safety) systems and subsystems with concurrence of management.
* Plans, schedules, and coordinates the moves/adds/changes of computing elements (server, storage & network hardware).
* Provide operational support for sales, Centersquare Service Center and Tier II by providing documentation such as one-line drawings for electrical and mechanical equipment.
* Maintain and update documentations and drawings for security system, BMS and Network diagrams.
* Support Centersquare Network team on installations drawings.
* Coordinates and interfaces with change management, business clients, application support and other operations personnel.
* Engages in restoral efforts to resolve system outages. Participates or leads physical security activities, disaster recovery procedures, and standards compliance.
* Analyzes infrastructure resource capacities and consumption, recommending solutions to reduce data center / technical space risk.
* Provides guidance and ensures adherence to Centersquare policies and procedures. May also be responsible for training and technical development of other operations personnel.
* Participates or leads physical security activities, disaster recovery procedures, and standards compliance.
* Analyzes infrastructure resource capacities and consumption, recommending solutions to reduce data center / technical space risk.
* Provides guidance and ensures adherence to Centesrquare policies and procedures.
* May also be responsible for training and technical development of other operations personnel.


*Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.*

  


**Competencies**

  


* **Strategic Planning:** Executing the infrastructure operations support component of new data center launches, and existing data center expansions.
* **Leadership:** Building an excellent customer relationship. Strong customer service. Knowledge of stakeholder analysis. Interfaces directly with customers, sales, and solution center engineers. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization’s policies and procedures. Responsible for on-site management of the local IDC operations and building engineering team on delivery of all aspects of data center services and activities. Leads IDC operations, security and building engineering teams to maintain critical building infrastructure, and data center operation. Leads Data Center tours for potential clients, supports sales and marketing organizations. Accountability for meeting and exceeding operational goals. Appraise performance; reward and discipline employees; resolve problems; and address staffing needs.
* **Budget Management:** Knowledgeable in Capital and Capital Expend budget planning. Responsible for securing quotes, funding and on time approving of invoices.
* **Operations Management:** Experience in Project Management, Technical knowledge and know-how of the Server, Storage and Networking Components deployment. Understanding the networking components, current future layouts for the technical centers; Familiarity with the Data Center industry standards. Develop procedures to bring servers and networking components back up; Develop and perform Business Continuity Planning and Disaster Recovery Procedures to restore the entire Data Center back online. Accommodate the needs from request coming from upstream, availability capacity/ planning future. Space and floor planning utilizing Visio and other company provided tools. Experience in power capacity management for existing clients and accommodate the needs for future clients. Experience in planning the Data Center Cooling Management. Understanding of ASHRAE standards. Experience in network capacity planning and management. Understanding of TIA standards for Horizontal Structural Cabling Systems. Develop and implement Building Emergency Plans. Manage Physical Access Control, Camera policies, Conduct Security Audits. Develop Monthly, Quarterly and Annual. Maintenance Plan that includes Power Maintenance, Planning Maintenance activities, 52-week plan. Understanding proper data center/technical space layout. Understand how HOT aisle COLD aisle, understanding how servers work with heating and cooling. Understanding of the emerging technologies such as Virtualization, VOIP and Cloud Computing, Understanding the impacts of virtualization on the Data Center Design and Management. Project management, customer provisioning and installation.
* **Vendor Management:** Performance management of key vendors such as outsourced service providers, Build-To-Suit, and maintenance vendors in line with company goals
* **Process Management:** Develop and update Centersquare Data Center Standards using industry best practices and standards. Familiar with IT and Data Center Industry Standards, i.e., TIA, NFPA, ASHRAE, and IEEE, and local codes.
* Superior verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills.
* Collaborate with executive-level management in the development of performance goals and long-term operational plans.
* Extremely proficient in Microsoft Office Suite or related software.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Analytical, decision-making, and problem-solving skills.


**Supervisory Responsibility**



Supervise and manage a team of 3-8 direct reports.

  


**Work Environment**



On-site, data center facility.

  


**Physical Demands**



The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.


* Occasional lifting of 20 lbs. or less.
* Regularly required to talk or hear.
* Frequently required to stand, walk, sit; use hands/fingers and reach with hands and arms.

  


**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work**



Must be available for on call 24/7.


**Travel**



Multi-Site Coverage as needed.

  


**Required Education and Experience**


* Bachelor’s degree in operations management, or engineering, or Information Technology or 5 years related field experience.


**Additional Eligibility Qualifications**


* CDCMP or other Data Center Operations Management Certification preferred.
* Familiar with PCI, SOC, and ISO 27001 industry audits.
* Hands on experience with industry audit practices.


**Work Authorization/Security Clearance (if applicable)**



Click or tap here to enter text.

  


*Centersquare is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.*

  

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Director of Memory Care/Reflections
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else's life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You'll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You'll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal "hospitality with a higher purpose." We know you'll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*


We are seeking a caring, dedicated and experienced LPN nurse supervisor to become the **Director of Reflections,** our dedicated Alzheimer's and dementia Memory Care Neighborhood at our beautiful and luxurious community. In this crucial role, you will be responsible for the day-to-day management and success of the Reflections Program, including planning, organizing and coordinating special needs programs. You will also provide team member supervision and training, and act as a liaison and advocate for our residents and their families. This is a hands-on position requiring occasional participation in assisting residents with ADLs.

**Additional responsibilities include:**

* Ensuring that resident care and management needs are sufficiently and appropriately assessed
* Serving as the liaison between residents, the resident's legal representatives, their families, administrative staff and community-based service providers
* Motivating and developing team members, including providing in-service education of the special needs program to Reflections area team members on health/wellness related topics
* Leading the daily operations of the Reflections Memory Care area and ensuring compliance with company and Department of Health (DOH) regulatory policies and standards regarding resident admission and discharge procedure as well as compiling appropriate medical case notes and other required documentation
* Scheduling and overseeing team members and assisting with medication management


Full-time schedule requires working one weekend day per week (Tues-Sat or Sun-Thurs).

**Qualifications:**

* At least three (3) years working intimately with Alzheimer's or dementia patients and a minimum 5 years' experience working with the geriatric population
* Graduate from an accredited school of nursing and an active Licensed Practical Nurse-LPN
* A minimum of two (2 ) years of supervisory experience in an assisted living, skilled nursing, clinical or similar healthcare related field is preferred
* Experience planning and administering in-service education programs
* Demonstrate exceptional leadership skills as a mentor who can lead by example
* Possess a working knowledge of medical and nursing terminology
* Knowledge of geriatric care needs, supervision and administration
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to speak clearly, concisely and confidently with residents and their families, physicians, property personnel and other key stakeholders
* Exceptional multitasking, organizational and time management skills a must
* Ability and flexibility to excel despite frequent work interruptions
* Reset priorities in order to complete work responsibilities in a timely manner
* Apply discretion in handling confidential information
* Ability to cope with the mental and emotional stress related to working with special needs population
* Strong computer skills and proficiency with Microsoft Office

**Benefits include:**

* Salary increases based on annual performance
* Annual team appreciation events, quarterly team appreciation bonuses, and an annual holiday bonus
* 401K plan
* AFLAC Benefits
* Company-paid life insurance policy
* PTO days, company-paid holidays, with a PTO cash-out option annually
* Optional lunch for all employees
* Available health, dental and vision coverage
* $6,000 tuition reimbursement per year for the LPN to RN Bridge Program

**New Jersey locations: Must have or be willing to get a COVID-19 vaccine, subject to legal accommodations**
company_description: The Bristal Assisted Living is the premier in senior living with 24 locations throughout the tri-state area inlcuding Long Island, Westchester, Manhattan, and New Jersey.

title: Laboratory Aide
description:
Bridge Dermpath is a physician-owned practice that specializes in the field of dermatopathology. Our state-of-the-art laboratory is located in Tarrytown, NY. This position is full-time with a work schedule of Monday-Friday from 7:00 PM until 3:30 AM.

**Job Responsibilities:**

· Completes lab QC logs in a timely manner

· Records all information accurately, neatly, and legibly on appropriate forms

· Ensures staining solution levels are within the established range

· Changes/rotates staining solutions and rotates reagents/supplies according to dates received and/or expiration dates

· Assembles slides according to case number in slide tray with corresponding requisition slip

· Distributes glass slides to pathologists

· Handles and disposes chemical wastes with appropriate PPE

· Performs routine cleaning and maintenance of lab technician stations, slide stainer, & coverslippers

· Ensures that surfaces of tissue processors are free of paraffin after removing baskets at the end of tissue processing

· Cleans exterior of laboratory equipment and work areas using appropriate cleaning solutions

· Pulls specimen(s) from specimen storage room as asked by pathologist or technical staff

· Pulls specimens from storage shelves in preparation for tissue discard

· Ensures specimens are appropriately filed in storage room

· Receives and delivers shipments to their respective areas

· Conducts routine inventory and item rotation; maintains all inventory in POS

· Keeps storage areas free of clutters

· Immediate notification of existing and/or potential problems to the proper authority

· Perform other related duties as assigned

**Job Requirements:**

**Education:**

High School Diploma or equivalent required

Bachelor of Science/Art Degree preferred

**Work Experience/Physical Requirements:**

· 1+ years of Laboratory experience

· Must be able to manage multiple tasks at once

· Proven ability to work in a fast-paced work environment while maintaining the highest levels of accuracy

· Must have excellent verbal, writing, and reading comprehension of English language

· Must have excellent attention to detail

· Ability to lift 50+ lbs

· Ability to stand and walk for prolonged periods of time

· Ability to properly handle various hazardous chemicals

Bridge Dermpath provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Disability insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance

Schedule:

title: Retail Sales Associate
description:
As a Retail Sales Associate, you’ll be the face of Best Buy for everyone who visits our stores. We’ll train you with the skills and knowledge you need to confidently recommend the right tech products and solutions for each customer. By creating a great shopping experience and inspiring people with what’s possible, you’ll help us enrich lives through technology.  

  

**What you’ll do*** Welcome and engage with customers in a warm, friendly manner
* Serve as a brand ambassador by bringing together your passion for people and technology to serve our customers
* Recommend products and solutions that meet customers’ needs
* Complete cashier duties for purchases, returns and exchanges
* Apply the appropriate knowledge and expertise through ongoing learning and development
* Ensure your department is clean and well stocked

**Basic qualifications*** Working and thriving in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment
* Working a flexible schedule that matches your availability (weekends, nights, holidays, etc.)

**What’s in it for you**  

  

We’re committed to helping our people thrive at work and at home. We offer generous benefits that address your total well-being and provide support as you need it, especially key moments in your life.  

  

Our benefits include:* Competitive pay
* Generous employee discount
* Financial savings and retirement resources
* Support for your physical and mental well-being

**About us**  

  

As part of the Best Buy team, you’ll help us fulfill our purpose to enrich lives through technology. We bring that to life every day by humanizing and personalizing tech solutions for every stage of life — in our stores, online and in customers’ homes.  

  

Our culture is built on deeply supporting and valuing our amazing employees who make it all possible. We’re committed to being a great place to work, where you can unlock unique career possibilities. Above all, we aim to provide a place where you can bring your full, authentic self to work now and into the future. Tomorrow works here.™  

Best Buy is an equal opportunity employer.  

  

**Application deadline:** Minimum of 5 days from the posting date. You can find that date above the job title at the top of the page.
