### **Description and Requirements**

**MetLife Investment Management – Real Estate – 2025 Summer Analyst Internship**

**Job Title**: Summer Analyst

**Business Units**: Debt Strategies Group, Equity Strategies Group, Research, Valuations & Analytics, Regional Offices

**Locations Available**: Atlanta, GA; Chicago, IL; Dallas, TX; Los Angeles, CA; San Francisco, CA; Washington, DC; Whippany, NJ

 **Company Overview**: MetLife Investment Management (MIM) is the institutional asset management business of MetLife, Inc. (NYSE: MET), one of the world’s leading financial services companies. MIM serves institutional investors, including MetLife’s general account investment teams, by combining a client-centric approach with deep, asset-class expertise established over 150 years of disciplined risk-management experience. Focused on managing Public Fixed Income, Private Capital, and Real Estate assets, we aim to deliver strong, risk-adjusted returns by building tailored portfolio solutions. MetLife Investment Management had $587.6 billion of total assets under management as of June 30, 2024, for our institutional clients and MetLife’s general account. Further information is available at investments.metlife.com.

 **Department Overview**: Real Estate and Agricultural Finance maintains a portfolio invested in commercial real estate and agricultural mortgages, as well as real estate equity assets. Real Estate Investments had $104.1 billion of total assets under management on a gross asset value basis as of June 30, 2024. Real Estate sources and manages commercial real estate investments through seven regional field offices in the U.S. and International field offices in London, Tokyo, Mexico City, and Santiago.

 **Program Description**: MetLife Investment Management’s Summer Analyst Program is a 10-week hybrid internship program providing participants broad exposure to a global investment manager and a specific asset class of their choosing. Summer analysts will develop various technical and analytical skills, have the opportunity to network with professionals across the company, and fully immerse themselves in MIM’s culture.

 **Internship Program Dates**: June 2, 2025 to August 8, 2025 (10 weeks)

 **Opportunity**: Candidates will be able to rank their preferences for placement in the following locations

* Whippany, NJ (Investments Headquarters)
* Atlanta, GA
* Chicago, IL
* Dallas, TX
* Los Angeles, CA
* San Francisco, CA
* Washington, DC

 **Investments Headquarters (Whippany, NJ)**: Summer analysts at investment headquarters will be placed into the Real Estate Debt Strategies Group (DSG), Equity Strategies Group (ESG), Research, Valuations & Analytics (RVA), or the Northeast Regional Office (NERO). Placements will be determined based on candidate interests and business unit matching. Here is a summary of the 4 units.

 **Debt Strategies Group (Whippany, NJ)**: During the summer internship, the Real Estate Debt Strategies Group (DSG) placement will provide an excellent introduction to the various aspects of institutional real estate investment, focusing on commercial mortgages. DSG focuses on the origination and management of commercial mortgages and the portfolio management of MIM’s clients. The summer analyst will gain hands-on exposure to commercial mortgage underwriting, portfolio management, risk management, and asset and client management for our third-party investors.

  

Real Estate Investments had $68.5 billion of total assets under management in commercial mortgage loans on a gross market value basis as of June 30, 2024.

 **Equity Strategies Group (Whippany, NJ)**: During the summer internship, the Real Estate Equity Strategies Group (ESG) placement will provide an excellent introduction to the various aspects of institutional real estate investment, focusing on real estate equity. ESG focuses on real estate equity investment, asset management, and portfolio management. The summer analyst will gain hands-on exposure to commercial real estate underwriting, portfolio management, risk management, and asset and client management for our third-party investors.

  

Real Estate Investments had $35.46 billion of total assets under management in real estate equity on a gross market value basis as of June 30, 2024.

 **Research, Valuations & Analytics (Whippany, NJ)**: During the summer internship, the Real Estate Research, Valuations & Analytics placement will provide an excellent introduction to the various aspects of institutional real estate investment management, focusing on risk management, valuations, research & strategy, and portfolio performance analytics. The summer analyst will gain hands-on exposure to various support functions in a leading commercial real estate debt and equity platform.

 **Northeast Regional Office (Whippany, NJ)**: (Please see description for “Regional Offices”)

  

Depending on business unit placement, specific responsibilities may include some of the following:

* Review potential loan or equity transactions in Investment Committee
* Participate in portfolio surveillance and portfolio management meetings
* Support the Portfolio Manager and Head of Equity Strategies / Debt Strategies in special projects related to the expansion of MetLife’s Real Estate Investment Management platform
* Establish strong working relationships with MetLife’s regional office network, Institutional Client Group, Research, and Finance departments
* Assist with the completion of monthly / quarterly / annual internal and external client reporting packages
* Track and report on various portfolio metrics such as sales and delegated authority transactions
* Assist in ongoing projects for our flagship Commercial Mortgage Income Debt Fund, Hotel Debt Fund, MetLife Core Property Fund, MetLife Enhanced Core Fund, and others, which may include working on the deal pipeline, gathering loan documents for transactions, investor requests, and general operational activities
* Assist our Separate Account team in serving our third-party clients on new and existing loan participations and equity deals
* Work with IT partners and others in the enhancement of various systems
* Production of portfolio analytics in support of the assessment of geographic, industry, tenant, and borrower exposures
* Real estate market research, analysis, and forecasting in support of investment decisions and portfolio strategy
* Commercial mortgage risk assessment and bond-equivalent ratings
* Support internal and external valuation and appraisal review oversight processes
* Construction of underwriting tools and benchmarks
* Assist in communicating house view of market trends, risks, and outlook via presentations and reports
* Participate in ad-hoc assignments as determined by the team’s needs and requirements at that time
* Participate in broader MIM 2025 Summer Analyst Program projects

 **Regional Offices (Atlanta, GA; Chicago, IL; Dallas, TX; Los Angeles, CA; San Francisco, CA; Washington, DC; Whippany, NJ)**: During the summer internship, the Regional Office placement will provide an excellent introduction to the various aspects of institutional real estate investment management with a mix of boots-on-the-ground and portfolio management perspectives. The summer analyst will gain hands-on exposure to the various aspects of real estate debt and equity investments, such as the regional office’s commercial mortgage origination, acquisitions, development, and asset management efforts by completing property and market analyses and assisting in the internal investment committee approval processes and closings. Additionally, the summer analyst will gain exposure to commercial underwriting, asset management, and risk management on a decentralized, regional level and work with portfolio managers to support our third-party investors. The internship will enhance personal credentials and offer the summer analyst the opportunity to establish relationships with industry professionals.

 **Specific responsibilities may include some of the following**:

* Commercial mortgage risk analysis and rating
* Equity and commercial mortgage portfolio risk analysis and surveillance reporting
* Tracking Mortgage and Equity transaction pipelines
* Assisting with marketing strategy, including prospecting and implementation
* Real estate valuation and underwriting of new commercial mortgage transactions
* Equity property valuation, lease analysis, and capital budget planning / implementation
* Collection, compilation, and reporting of real estate market, economic and demographic information
* Credit analysis of existing or prospective tenants and/or borrowing entities
* Financial modeling and scenario analysis of development projects and existing equity properties
* Reviewing and identifying risks within property condition reports
* Conduct property tours for assets in the existing portfolio as well as prospective new investments
* Portfolio (mortgage and equity) surveillance and asset management activities may include


o Lease review and abstracts


o ARGUS modeling


o Investment valuation


o Property tours / inspections


o Capital and operating budget preparation


o Investment committee presentations

* Participate in ad-hoc assignments as determined by the team’s needs and requirements at that time
* Participate in broader MIM 2025 Summer Analyst Program projects

  

The responsibilities described here are not exhaustive, and additional assignments, duties, or responsibilities may be required of this position. MIM may change assignments, duties, and responsibilities at any time, with or without notice, by its sole discretion.

 **Candidate Skills and Qualifications**:


MIM seeks to hire individuals who work well in team-based settings, are highly motivated, intelligent, have sound judgment, have solid analytical skills, and have demonstrated excellence in prior endeavors.

 **Required Skills and Qualifications**:

* Candidate must be currently enrolled in a higher education institution and actively pursuing an undergraduate degree with a strong academic record and a demonstrated interest in real estate. Candidates pursuing master's degrees or other advanced degrees are ineligible.
* Candidate’s anticipated graduation date must be between December 2025 and June 2027
* Candidate must have a strong work ethic, personal and professional integrity, and be able to adapt to new challenges in a dynamic environment while handling multiple projects
* Candidate must be able to work independently and in a team environment, remaining detail-oriented and client-focused
* Candidate must have excellent written and verbal communication skills and feel comfortable interacting with management-level professionals
* Candidate must be familiar with Microsoft Office products such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

 **Preferred Skills and Qualifications:**

* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office products such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint is strongly preferred
* Familiarity with ARGUS

  

MetLife is committed to building a purpose-driven and inclusive culture that energizes our people. Our employees work every day to help build a more confident future for people around the world.  

We want to make it simple for all interested and qualified candidates to apply for employment opportunities with MetLife. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request to accommodations@metlife.com or call our Employee Relations Department at 1-877-843-3711.  

MetLife is a proud Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer dedicated to attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse and inclusive workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment at MetLife without regards to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, uniformed service member or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  

MetLife maintains a drug-free workplace.  

In connection with this open position, MetLife will only consider job applicants who are legally authorized to work in the United States without an employer-sponsored petition for a visa, such as an H-1B visa. It will not file any visa applications in connection with this position.  


  

*The salary range for applicants for this position is $27- $33 per hour.*

*Recognized on Fortune magazine's list of the 2023 "World's Most Admired Companies" as well as the 2023 Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For ®, MetLife*, through its subsidiaries and affiliates, is one of the world’s leading financial services companies; providing insurance, annuities, employee benefits and asset management to individual and institutional customers. title: 2025 MIM Agricultural Finance Internship
description:
Location(s)

* Posting Location: Germantown, Tennessee

* Posting Location: Whippany, New Jersey

### **Description and Requirements**

**MetLife Investment Management – Agricultural Finance – 2025 Summer Analyst Internship**

**Job Title**: Summer Analyst

**Business Units**: Agricultural Strategies Group, Food & Agribusiness, Farm & Ranch, Timberland & Forest Products, Research & Analytics

**Locations Available**: Fresno, CA; Germantown, TN; Overland Park, KS; Whippany, NJ

 **Company Overview**: MetLife Investment Management (MIM) is the institutional asset management business of MetLife, Inc. (NYSE: MET), one of the world’s leading financial services companies. MIM serves institutional investors, including MetLife’s general account investment teams, by combining a client-centric approach with deep, asset-class expertise established over 150 years of disciplined risk-management experience. Focused on managing Public Fixed Income, Private Capital, and Real Estate assets, we aim to deliver strong, risk-adjusted returns by building tailored portfolio solutions. MetLife Investment Management had $587.6 billion of total assets under management as of June 30, 2024, for our institutional clients and MetLife’s general account. Further information is available at investments.metlife.com.

 **Department Overview**: Real Estate and Agricultural Finance maintains a portfolio invested in commercial real estate and agricultural mortgages, as well as equity assets within specific real estate sectors. Agricultural Finance had $21.2 billion of total assets under management as of June 30, 2024. Agricultural Finance sources agricultural farm, ranch, agribusiness, timberland and forest products mortgage investments through three regional field offices in the US, an international field office in Mexico City and a consulting office in Sao Paulo, Brazil.

 **Program Description**: MetLife Investment Management’s Summer Analyst Program is a 10-week hybrid internship program, providing participants broad exposure to a global investment manager and specific insights into the agriculture finance sector. Summer analysts will develop various technical and analytical skills, have the opportunity to network with professionals across the company, and fully immerse themselves in MIM’s culture.

 **Internship Program Dates**: June 2, 2025 to August 8, 2025 (10 weeks)

 **Opportunity**: Candidates will be able to rank their preferences for placement in the following business units and corresponding locations.

* Whippany, NJ


o Agricultural Strategies Group


o Research & Analytics

* Regional Offices


o Fresno, CA


o Germantown, TN


o Overland Park, KS

 **Agricultural Strategies Group (Overland Park, KS & Whippany, NJ)**: During the internship, the Agricultural Strategies Group (ASG) placement will provide an introduction to agricultural finance, focusing on strategic direction of a portfolio of agricultural mortgages. ASG guides the origination and management functions of a portfolio of agricultural mortgages for MIM’s clients. The summer analyst will gain hands-on exposure to agricultural mortgage underwriting, portfolio management, risk management, and asset and client management for our third-party investors. The internship will enhance personal credentials and offer the summer analyst the opportunity to establish relationships with industry professionals.

 **Specific responsibilities may include some of the following**:

* Support the Agricultural Finance’s management team in driving portfolio performance and platform growth;
* Leverage Agriculture Finance’s strong working relationships across internal business units (regional offices, Institutional Client Group, Research and Finance departments) to support ASG responsibilities and deliver upon management expectations;
* Coordination of monthly / quarterly / annual internal and external client reporting packages;
* Assist in the preparation and communication of portfolio metrics/analysis to internal and external stakeholders;
* Participate in portfolio surveillance and Investment Committee meetings, and
* Active engagement across MIM 2025 Summer Analyst Program projects

 **Research & Analytics (Whippany, NJ)**: During the summer internship, the Agricultural Research & Analytics placement will provide an introduction to institutional agricultural investment management, focusing on risk management, valuations, research & strategy, and portfolio performance analytics. The summer analyst will support our industry-leading agricultural debt platform, while enhancing personal credentials and developing relationships with industry professionals.

 **Specific responsibilities may include some of the following**:

* Analytical support for the Research & Analytics teams;
* Agricultural market research, analysis, and forecasting in support of investment decisions and portfolio strategy;
* Develop and utilize existing portfolio analytics to assess exposure;
* Evaluation of portfolio positioning, including opportunities and risks;
* Support client and management portfolio reporting;
* Support internal and external valuation and appraisal review oversight processes;
* Construction of underwriting tools and benchmarks;
* Assist in communicating house view of market trends, risks, and outlook via presentations and reports, and
* Participate in broader MIM 2025 Summer Analyst Program projects

 **Regional Offices (Fresno, CA; Germantown, TN; Overland Park, KS)**: During the summer internship, the Regional Office placement will provide an introduction to operational aspects of agricultural mortgage investment sourcing and servicing, as well as portfolio management. The summer analyst may lead or support property and market analyses, assist on the documentation requirements associated with internal investment committee approval processes and closings, or evaluate specific servicing actions requiring elevated levels of approval. The summer analyst will also gain exposure to agricultural credit underwriting, asset and risk management on a regional level, and work with portfolio managers to support third-party investors. The internship will enhance personal credentials and provide the opportunity to establish relationships with industry professionals.

 **Specific responsibilities may include some of the following**:

* Support associates’ efforts to source and originate new loans and manage an existing mortgage portfolio;
* Conduct property underwriting, valuation and market analysis to evaluate new mortgage opportunities across a range of property types and geographies;
* Collaborate with MIM associates, brokers, property owners, attorneys and other transaction counterparts in a professional manner to perform due diligence throughout the closing process;
* Support the preparation of investment memoranda and participate in deal underwriting, presentations to the debt investment committee;
* Assist with loan asset management functions, including financial statement analysis, loan monitoring, borrower requests, property inspections, management and investor reporting;
* Perform internal and external ad hoc reporting, pipeline tracking using MetLife’s proprietary mortgage production system and provide systems database support;
* Participate in ad-hoc assignments determined by the team’s needs and requirements at that time, and
* Participate in broader MIM 2025 Summer Analyst Program projects

  

The responsibilities described here are not exhaustive, and additional assignments, duties, or responsibilities may be required of this position. MIM may change assignments, duties, and responsibilities at any time, with or without notice, by its sole discretion.

 **Candidate Skills and Qualifications**:


MIM seeks to hire individuals who work well in team-based settings, are highly motivated, intelligent, have sound judgment, have solid analytical skills, and have demonstrated excellence in prior endeavors.

 **Required Skills and Qualifications**:

* Candidate must be currently enrolled in a higher education institution and actively pursuing an undergraduate degree with a strong academic record and a demonstrated interest in agriculture. Candidates pursuing master's degrees or other advanced degrees are ineligible.
* Candidate’s anticipated graduation date must be between December 2025 and June 2027
* Candidate must have a strong work ethic, personal and professional integrity, and be able to adapt to new challenges in a dynamic environment while handling multiple projects
* Candidate must be able to work independently and in a team environment, remaining detail-oriented and client-focused
* Candidate must have excellent written and verbal communication skills and feel comfortable interacting with management-level professionals
* Candidate must be familiar with Microsoft Office products such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

 **Preferred Skills and Qualifications**:

* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office, including Power BI and Teams, is preferred.
* Some agricultural experience, including experience in core regional crops (e.g., row crops, dairy, livestock), is a plus.

title: Bookkeeper/AP Clerk
description:
**Job title: Bookkeeper**

**Reports to: Accountant/Chief Financial Officer**

**FLSA Status: Non-Exempt / Full Time**

**Date Issued: February 2022**

 **POSITION SUMMARY:**

  

The Bookkeeper performs accounts payable functions according to established procedures or as directed by the Chief Financial Officer. The Bookkeeper maintains internal contacts with the entire administrative staff and external contact with vendor accounts payable departments.

  

The essential functions of the job include, but are not limited to the duties listed in the job description.

 **Employee may be required to carry out additional duties as assigned by Supervisor.**

 **ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:**

**Through the employee’s own efforts, the employee accomplishes the following essential functions:**

 **1) Accounts Payable**-Responsible for the processing and verification necessary to ensure accurate payment of all legitimate invoices on a timely basis by means of the following procedures:

  

* Verifies invoices for quantity, unit price, extension, and discount.
* Routes miscellaneous invoices to proper people for approval for payment.
* Verifies accounting account numbers to invoices coded on site for proper distribution in financial statements, including allocating expenses to proper period.
* Coordinates schedule for computer time for voucher reports, remittance advices, checks and journals.
* Maintains a log of invoices vouched batch number and dollar amount.
* Maintains file of vouched invoices waiting for payment.
* Issue checks as needed and upon special request or in accordance with schedule based on availability of funds.
* Attaches original invoices to duplicate copy of check for permanent record of paid invoices.
* Maintains the file of paid invoices.
* Communicates with shelter/programs regarding errors or questions on invoices.
* Coordinates the efforts of additional help required to meet above schedules.
* Verifies month end totals of Accounts Distribution, Cash Disbursements and Open Items reports and coordinate closing to the general ledger.

  

DHS Billing

  

* Maintain daily census for monthly billing. Keep daily roaster file up to date.
* Reconcile Monthly DHS billing using the daily census. Produce discrepancy report when necessary. Book monthly invoice for DHS billing according to the reconciliation.

**Payroll**

* Receive Bi – weekly Pay checks prepare for distribution to each site.

 **Special Projects**

* As needed special projects assigned by Management.

 **Employee may be required to carry out additional duties as assigned by Supervisor.**

 **ADDITIONAL JOB FUNCTIONS:**

  

* Adheres to all policies and procedures, including those prescribed in the Highland Park CDC Employee Handbook.
  

* Maintain confidentiality and do not disclose information learned through the course of the job with people other than those who need to know including employee information, financial information, client information, etc.
 **COMPETENCIES****:**

**To perform the job successfully, an individual demonstrates the following competencies.**

* **Customer Service Orientation: Manages difficult or emotional situations with internal and external stakeholders; Responds promptly to customer needs; Responds to request for service and assistance. Maintains and communicates a positive “can do” attitude with internal and external stakeholders.**
* **Problem Solving: Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Uses reason when dealing with emotional topics.**
* **Systems Thinking:** Demonstrates an ability to (a) see how organizational systems (*e.g., internal/external conditions, processes, people*) interact and influence each other, and (b) how these systems create and contribute to specific issues (*e.g., high voluntary turnover*) and strengths (*e.g., strong customer focus*).
* **Planning / Organization: Prioritizes and plans work activities; Uses time efficiently: Plans for additional resources; Develops realistic action plans. Leverages tools to manage workflow and reprioritizes accordingly.**
* **Service and Teamwork** - Understands the needs and wants of the organization, customers, co-workers and supervisors in order to provide accurate, complete and timely service and to further the mission, values and goals of the organization.
* **Oral Communication: Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; listens and gets clarification.**
* **Written Communication: Writes clearly and informatively; Edits work for spelling and grammar; Varies writing style to meet needs; Presents numerical data effectively; Able to read and interpret written information.**
* **Ethics: Treats people with respect: Inspires the trust of others; Works with integrity and ethically; Upholds organizational values.**
* **Dependability: Follows instructions; Responds to management direction; Takes responsibility for own actions; Keeps commitments.**
* **Initiative: Volunteers readily; Undertakes self-development activities; Seeks increased responsibilities; Takes independent actions and calculated risks; Looks for and takes advantage of opportunities; Asks for and offers help when needed.**
 **QUALIFICATIONS:**

**To perform this job successfully, and individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and / or ability required.**

* **Minimum Required Education & Experience:**
	+ **Associates Degree in Accounting or related field**
	+ 1 to 3 years of specialized experience in Accounts payable and billing.

* **Preferred Education & Experience:**
	+ **Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or related field**
	+ **2 years related experience.**
	+ **Previous work experience with homeless population, MICA, or Veterans community**

* **Computer Skills:**
	+ Proficient in computer software programs (QB online, Word, Excel, Power Point, CARES, etc.)
* **Language skills:**
* **Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Reads and comprehends simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos; Writes simple correspondence; Presents information in one-on-one and small groups situations outside stakeholders, clients and other employees.**
* **Bilingual is preferred**

 **GENERAL PHYSICAL REQUIRMENTS AND WORKING CONDITIONS****:**

* **GENERAL WORKING HOURS:**
	+ Generally, this position is Monday through Friday.
* **WORKING FROM HOME:**
	+ Most essential functions of this job cannot be completed working from home.
* **TRAVEL:**
	+ May be required to travel about 5% of the time to purchase items or to attend a training or go to the post office as needed.
* **PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:**
* **The physical activity for the Accountant/Bookkeeper is:**
* **Climbing & Ambulating Stairs:** Ascending or descending stairs and ramps using feet and legs and/or hands and arms. Must be able to walk up and down stairs (about 10 flights) in order to patrol stairways, respond to security incidents, and assist in the evacuation of clients during an emergency. Body agility is emphasized. The amount of climbing required exceeds that required for ordinary locomotion.

* **Stooping:** Bending body downward and forward by bending spine at the waist. This factor is important if it occurs to a considerable degree and requires full use of the lower extremities and back muscles.
* **Kneeling:** Bending legs at knee to come to a rest on knee or knees.
* **Crouching:** Bending the body downward and forward by bending leg and spine.
* **Reaching**. Extending hand(s) and arm(s) in any direction.
* **Walking.** Moving about on foot to accomplish tasks, and has an ability to navigate from one location to another.
* **Standing:** Remaining upright on the feet, particularly for sustained periods of time.
* **Lifting.** Must raise objects from a lower to a higher position or move objects horizontally from position to-to-position.
* **Fingering:** Picking, pinching, typing or otherwise working, primarily with fingers rather than with whole hand or arm as in handling. Ability to use computer tablet to write reports, notes and document compliance with patrol stops.
* **Grasping:** Applying pressure to an object with the fingers and palm.
* **Talking:** Expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word; those activities where detailed or important spoken instructions must be conveyed to other workers accurately, loudly, or quickly.
* **Hearing:** Perceiving the nature of sounds at normal speaking levels with or without correction, and having the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication, and making fine discriminations in sound.
* **Feeling**. Must be able to perceive attributes of objects, such as size, shape, temperature or texture by touching with skin, particularly that of fingertips. Assesses potential safety threats, such as by exposure to chemicals and heat from malfunctioning equipment.
  

* **Physical requirements for the Accountant:**
	+ **Sedentary work:** Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and / or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects, including the human body. Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time, with walking and standing required only occasionally.

  

* **The visual acuity requirements for the Accountant/Bookkeeper (*****including color, depth perception and field vision*****).**
	+ Required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as preparing and analyzing data and figures, transcribing, viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading; visual inspection to determine the accuracy, neatness, and thoroughness of the work.

* **The Bookkeeper will be subject to the following conditions in this position:**
	+ **The worker is subject to inside environmental conditions, protected from weather conditions but not necessarily from temperature changes.**

  

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the Essential Functions. Reasonable accommodations may be made upon an employee’s request.  

This Job Description is not intended, and should not be construed, to be an exhaustive list of all Job Functions, Competencies, Skills and Work Environment/Conditions associated with this job. It is meant to be an accurate reflection of principal job elements useful for recruiting and selecting employees, assigning work and evaluating performance. Additional responsibilities may be assigned, and management retains the right to change this Job Description at any time. Acceptance of this Job Description does not constitute an employment agreement or contract. The Company is an at-will employer and reserves the right to terminate employment for any reason or no reason, with or without notice to the employee. **JOB DESCRIPTION ACKNOWLEDGEMENT AND ACCEPTANCE**

title: Part-Time Instructor, Interactive & Web Design, Fall 2024
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Part-Time Instructor, Interactive & Web Design, Fall 2024
  

**Department** SASN - Arts Culture & Media
  

**Salary** Salary per Credit
  

**Posting Summary**
The Department of Arts, Culture and Media, School of Arts and Sciences-Newark, Rutgers University-Newark, is seeking an experienced part-time instructor to teach courses in Interactive and Web Design in the undergraduate Graphic Design Program, Fall 2024. The ideal candidate should have the skills and knowledge to teach basic HTML/CSS, a strong background in user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design, and previous teaching experience at the college level. The role involves imparting foundational skills in web design, guiding students through both the technical and creative aspects of design for digital interactive experiences.

Course description: This course introduces students to the fundamental principles of design, development, production, and deployment of web-based digital media. Core theory, technologies, and processes that are essential to current practice will be discussed and explored. Students will develop an understanding of interface design principles (UI), visual/communication design, user experience (UX), web workflows, and the unique affordances of designing interactive experiences. Emphasis will be placed on understanding the web as a dynamic and flexible medium, learning the fundamentals of coding using HTML/CSS, and development of the skills to support self-initiated research and ongoing learning. Critical thinking, research-based design methodologies, and the quality of the design process will also be essential components of the class.

The successful candidate will cover the full range of duties associated with teaching, including, but not limited to, preparing course material; creating and posting a course syllabus; presenting material during the assigned course times; holding office hours and providing appropriate out-of-class time for students; responding to student e-mails; conducting and grading assessments of students through assignments, exams, and other means, in a timely manner; and submitting final grades. Course appointments may require instruction during the day, in the evenings, on weekends, off-campus, online, hybrid, remotely, or any combination of these.
  

**Position Status** Part Time
  

**Posting Number** 24FA0794
  

**Posting Open Date** 08/05/2024
  

**Posting Close Date**
  

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
Bachelor’s degree preferred. Master’s degree or Ph.D. strongly preferred.
  

**Certifications/Licenses**
  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
Knowledge of HTML and CSS and a strong background in user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design required. Experience teaching code and UX-UI courses strongly preferred. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills a must. Demonstrated ability to teach at the university level is highly desired.
  

**Equipment Utilized**
  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
  

**Overview**
The School of Arts and Sciences-Newark (SASN) is a place where exploration, discovery, and imagination come together to form the core of a liberal arts education. We serve all undergraduates at Rutgers University-Newark (RU-N); and offer a broad selection of more than 2,000 undergraduate and graduate courses a year in more than 40 subjects. SASN combines the best of a large research university with a small liberal arts college. RU-N is a remarkably diverse, urban, public research university that is not just *in* Newark but *of* Newark-an anchor of our home city.
  

**Statement**
  

Posting Details
**Special Instructions to Applicants**
The email address listed on the application will be used for all communication.  

A syllabus for a course previously taught by the applicant should be included and uploaded under “Other Documents.”
  

**Quick Link to Posting** https://jobs.rutgers.edu/postings/233307
  

**Campus** Rutgers University-Newark
  

**Home Location Campus** Rutgers University-Newark
  

**City** Newark
  

**State** NJ

title: Dir, Strategic Planning - VP @ Rise & Run
description:
### **Basic Information**

Location
NJ Parsippany 3 Sylvan Way
Posted Date
05-Aug-2024

Rise & Run

Strategic Planning
Job Number
43892
Job Type
Regular
Posting Locations
United States - Boston, Massachusetts , United States - New York, New York , United States - Parsippany, New Jersey
Work Arrangement
Regular - Hybrid
### **Job Description**

**JOB SUMMARY**


The Dir, Strategic Planning, VP is a seasoned brand builder and client-facing planning lead with a strong track record of managing complex accounts and pitches. They possess exceptional strategic storytelling skills and the ability to guide insight generation and campaign development. With a talent for quickly building personal equity and establishing themselves as a strategic leader, they excel in taking on new and possibly more challenging accounts, leading new business and attending pitch presentations. Seen as a leader within the department, they are responsible for the supervision and career development of multiple levels of talent.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**

**Brand Planning**

* Expert in strategic discipline, agency processes and pharma compliance requirements.
* Translates market dynamics, customer insights and deep understanding of disease state to developing brand strategy and solving brand challenges.
* Displays strong story telling skills and voice as it relates to written strategy skills.
* New business leadership and pitch attendance.

**Client Management**

* Displays strategic leadership and facilitation of large and bespoke client workshops and brainstorming sessions.
* Drives influence toward a strategic POV and recommendation internally and with more senior clients.
* Serves as consultant to client on market research design, methodologies, and analysis.
* Strong strategic voice, driving clarification, direction, and leadership of internal and/or client meetings.

**Cross Functional Collaboration**

* Lead strategic planning responsibilities on multiple brands, integrated accounts, with autonomy and proficiency.
* Partner with other agency departments to ensure pull through of insights and strategy.
* Talent Management & Development
* Supervise and develop lower-level staff and delegate incoming tasks and assignments as appropriate.
* Responsible for hiring and staffing decisions and full life-cycle talent management (eg, delivering feedback, annual reviews, general and performance management)

**JOB DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Execute expert level understanding of the strategic planning fundamentals of disease state, indications, customer and science of assigned brands.
* Lead strategic planning responsibilities on multiple large and small accounts, new business and/or support senior planners on larger, integrated accounts, with autonomy and proficiency.
* Leads full suite of brand strategy deliverables (positioning, bedrock, creative briefs/briefings, message strategy, tactical planning) and mentor junior team members to achieve success.
* Market research expertise and consulting; drive insight mining/ideation to uncover strategic opportunities and inform and strengthen creative.
* Expert in planning tools and core competencies, driving proper use; positioning, insight generation and creative brief writing.
* Leadership of new business; immersion insight gathering, storytelling, strategy development and tactic pull throughand attendance.
* Strategic leadership and facilitation of large, complex and bespoke client workshops and/or brainstorm sessions.
* Directly supervises Director and Associate Director levels on brand(s), and provides mentorship/guidance to team as needed.
* Meets regularly with direct and indirect reports to proactively manage career development.
* Responsible for hiring, staffing, career development, and full life-cycle talent management for direct team (eg, delivering feedback, annual reviews, general and performance management).
* Demonstrates leadership, empathy and professionalism in communications.


COMPETENCIES
* Communication
* Expresses ideas accurately, concisely, and clearly.
* Curiosity
* Displays eagerness in learning and asks thought-provoking questions.
* Passion
* Demonstrates investment and commitment to brands, clients, teams, and assignments.
* Organization
* Creates clear goals, identifies, and finds the resources (eg, time, people, materials) needed to achieve them, and schedules tasks so that work is completed on time.
* Collaboration
* Ability to work effectively in a team environment to build and foster positive relationships, trust and confidence.
* Agility
* Ability to change directions quickly and think on your feet.
* Forward Thinking
* Focused on short term wins as well as building towards long-term success.
* Problem-Solving
* Shows interest in finding the cause of problems, looks for and chooses effective solutions, and takes the necessary action to resolve them.
* Assumption Challenger
* Challenge assumptions and traditional ways of doing things to bring disruptive strategies and new ideas to brands.
* Influence
* Presents in a way to command and influence key and relevant stakeholders.
* Accountability
Drive and motivates team towards actionable results. Keep themselves honest in effective output.  
* 
  

**QUALIFICATIONS**

**EDUCATION**


Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Advertising, Communications or Related Field Preferred

**EXPERIENCE**


8+ years in Brand strategy or market research in an agency setting preferred

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES**

* Competent in software specific to the client and agency processes including Microsoft Word, Teams, PowerPoint, Excel.
* Excellent working knowledge in research tools (search databases including SERMO, Datamonitor).
* Excellent working knowledge in social media platforms.
* Excellent oral and written communication.
* Excellent strategic thinking and analytical skills; triangulate insights and data from multiple
* sources/departments/agency. partners to analyze and solve problems.
* Able to work on multiple projects, adhere to timeline and maintain organization.
* Ability to use AI platforms as an accelerant for brand needs and strategic deliverables.
* Strong understanding of agency offerings, services, products and solutions.
* Expert level understanding of brand/pharma marketing and promotional strategy and trends (customer, industry,innovation).


SALARY


$160,000 to $230,000 annually


The salary range for this position is noted within this job posting. Where an employee or prospective employee is paid within this range will depend on, among other factors, actual ranges for current/former employees in the subject position; market considerations; budgetary considerations; tenure and standing with the company (applicable to current employees); as well as the employee’s/applicant’s background, pertinent experience, and qualifications.


For U.S. Job Seekers It is the policy of IPG Health and any of its affiliates to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, disability, or any other basis prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law. EOE/AA/M/D/V/F.

  

Apply now

title: Material Handler
description:
**What is Johnstone?**

**Johnstone Supply**- New Jersey is a family owned HVAC/R wholesale-distributor established in 1987. Currently there are ten branch locations in Northern/Central/Southern New Jersey, Lower New York, and one in Staten Island New York.


As a **Material Handler** you will be responsible for fulfilling orders of customers, replenishment, transfers, clean-up, providing excellent customer service, and assisting team members with daily tasks. If you are looking to be part of an amazing team that values the contributions of its staff, come apply with us!

**What will you be doing as a Material Handler?**

* Handle the processing of incoming orders from suppliers.
* Meet deadlines and schedules for routine procedures and deliveries.
* Handle shipping/receiving activity including, but not limited to UPS, auto freight, “will call,” store-to-store transfers, and LTL shipments.
* Ensure pick/pack and transfer orders are picked and packed focused on quality and accuracy according to the daily schedule.
* Check-in corporate orders the same day that they are received.
* Maintain the accurate locations for all inventory items.
* Maintain materials in good order and condition during handling, shipping, receiving and storage.
* Ensure cycle counts are completed in an efficient and accurate manner. Cycle counts are performed daily, according to Inventory Control needs.
* Properly load and unload vehicles ensuring load security.
* Process all required paperwork in a timely manner to allow for prompt invoicing of clients.
* Operate pallet movers, hand-trucks, forklift trucks and other material handling equipment according to safety regulations.
* Assist in the maintenance and upkeep of all warehouse machinery and equipment.
* Loading and unloading customer orders into company vehicle, delivering products to customers, and ensuring the maintenance, upkeep, and repairs of the company vehicles and warehouse.
* Following designated schedules and deadlines for delivery of local routes.
* Perform any other duty or task as may be assigned from time to time by the Branch Manager.

**What we are looking for in a Material Handler:**

* Requires a High School Diploma/GED
* Preferred: Certification in Forklift Operation. Experience with a picker, RF scanner and inventory experience.
* Preferred: Experience or knowledge of material handling a warehouse and/or distribution facility of a HVAC or related field, but not required
* Must be a highly organized, detailed person who can monitor numerous projects at once and who can prioritize workload.
* Must possess excellent verbal, math and written communication skills.
* Valid driver’s license.

**Johnstone Supply is More Than a Supply House**. By joining our team, you become part of a company with an established reputation of having a knowledgeable staff, unmatched customer service, efficiency-boosting technology offerings, widespread inventory, and valuable training opportunities. You will join an employee family that believes in working as a team to accomplish company goals as well as facilitating the professional growth of individual team members.


In addition to being part of a company that will help you achieve your goals by continuous professional development, we also offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes competitive pay, holidays, paid time off, extensive insurance options, 401K with an employer contribution, tuition reimbursement and employee discounts.

**What Benefits Do We Offer:**

* Health Insurance- three plans to pick from
* Dental Insurance- two plans to pick from
* Vision Insurance
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Paid Time Off
* Holiday Pay
* 401(k)- employer match and profit sharing

title: Part-Time Instructor, Graphic Design Portfolio Development, Fall 2024
description:
**Position Details**

Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Part-Time Instructor, Graphic Design Portfolio Development, Fall 2024
  

**Department** SASN - Arts Culture & Media
  

**Salary** Salary per Credit
  

**Posting Summary**
The Department of Arts, Culture and Media, School of Arts and Sciences-Newark, Rutgers University-Newark, is seeking an experienced part-time instructor to teach a senior-level Portfolio Development course in the undergraduate Graphic Design program, Fall 2024. The ideal candidate should have extensive experience in both the graphic design industry and in teaching at the college level. The position requires a deep understanding of portfolio creation and the ability to guide students in curating and presenting their best work. Candidates with a passion for mentoring aspiring designers and a proven track record in teaching are strongly preferred.

Course Description: This course addresses all facets of creating a Graphic Design portfolio by organizing, refining, and presenting a cohesive body of work, while acquiring the skills to navigate and prosper in the profession. Coursework underlines a development and understanding of personal brand identity, aesthetics, design sensibility, and creative process driven by one’s influences and personal expression. Classes balance lectures, discussions, critiques, and student presentations, emphasizing problem analysis; the relation between form, content, and media; as well as design craft and execution.

The successful candidate will cover the full range of duties associated with teaching, including, but not limited to, preparing course material; creating and posting a course syllabus; presenting material during the assigned course times; holding office hours and providing appropriate out-of-class time for students; responding to student e-mails; conducting and grading assessments of students through assignments, exams, and other means, in a timely manner; and submitting final grades. Course appointments may require instruction during the day, in the evenings, on weekends, off-campus, online, hybrid, remotely, or any combination of these.

**Minimum Education and Experience**
Bachelor’s degree preferred. Master’s degree or Ph.D. strongly preferred.
  

**Certifications/Licenses**

Extensive knowledge and understanding of portfolio creation required. Demonstrated ability to teach senior portfolio development at the university level and experience in the graphic design industry highly desired. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills a must.
  

**Equipment Utilized**
  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**

The School of Arts and Sciences-Newark (SASN) is a place where exploration, discovery, and imagination come together to form the core of a liberal arts education. We serve all undergraduates at Rutgers University-Newark (RU-N); and offer a broad selection of more than 2,000 undergraduate and graduate courses a year in more than 40 subjects. SASN combines the best of a large research university with a small liberal arts college. RU-N is a remarkably diverse, urban, public research university that is not just *in* Newark but *of* Newark-an anchor of our home city.

title: Patient Access Representative
description:
Patient Access Representative


As a Patient Access Representative, you play a critical role in ensuring the seamless operation of the healthcare environment, the delivery of quality patient care, and world-class customer service. Your responsibilities encompass greeting and assisting patients, managing appointments, maintaining accurate records, and providing essential administrative support. Additionally, you are responsible for obtaining authorizations and facilitating insurance-related processes to support the delivery of healthcare services.

**Who We Are:**

  

JAG Physical Therapy’s care-first model of rehabilitation may be the change you are looking for! JAG Physical Therapy, a comprehensive outpatient, orthopedic physical therapy company with 100 facilities throughout Pennsylvania, New Jersey, and New York, is seeking compassionate and motivated individuals to join our winning team! JAG has been honored by the area’s top publications as the best in the business based on growth and outcomes and is considered the Gold Standard for physical therapy care by the Metro area’s largest healthcare systems and insurance providers.

 **What You’ll Love About Us:**

* Competitive pay
* Support for ongoing education and training
* Opportunities for advanced growth including team leader, regional manager, and director
* Provided uniforms
* Health, Dental, & Vision Benefits
* HSA Options including dependent care, medical, and commuter benefits
* $10,000.00 Term Life Insurance benefit at NO cost to employees
* up to 3 weeks PTO
* 401(k) with company match
* Yearly review for growth opportunities
* Tuition discounts for employees and their families
* TicketsAtWork and LifeMart company perks
* Our workplace fosters a close-knit and supportive environment where individuals genuinely care for and uplift one another, creating a strong sense of unity and camaraderie

 **What You’ll Need:**

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Completion of a medical assistant certificate program preferred.
* 1+ years of experience working as a medical receptionist/administrative assistant in the health care field.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills
* Strong interpersonal communication skills
* Ability to work independently or as part of a team
* Availability to travel throughout JAG locations for coverage. Following the JAG Travel policy.

 **What You’ll Do:**

* Greeting patients and other visitors in the medical office.
* Answer patient questions and provide assistance and directions when necessary.
* Field all phone calls that arrive using our general office number.
* Utilize medical office software to schedule new and follow-up appointments for patients.
* Register new patients and update necessary records.
* Distribute forms and paperwork to patients to ensure that required fields are completed appropriately.
* Daily collection of patient financial responsibility
* Maintain confidentiality of all patient records.
* Completing and tracking insurance verifications, authorizations, and referrals.
* Knowledge of Workers’ Compensation and Auto claim submissions.
* Perform other diverse duties as requested or required.

 ***Important Disclaimer Notice:***


The above statements are only intended to represent the essential job functions and general nature of the work being performed and are not exhaustive of the tasks that an Employee may be required to perform. The employer reserves the right to revise this job description at any time and to require Employees to perform other tasks as circumstances or conditions of its business, competitive considerations, or the work environment change. This job description is not a guarantee of employment. What you’ll love about us section is based on full time employment with the company and is not guaranteed based on employment type.

description:

### **Description and Requirements**

**MetLife Investment Management – 2025 Summer Analyst Internship**

**Job Title**: Summer Analyst

**Business Units**: Public Fixed Income (PFI), Private Capital, MetLife Insurance Investments (MII), Institutional Client Group (ICG), Insurance Asset Management (IAM), Office of the CIO (OCIO), Operations

**Locations Available**: Whippany, NJ; Philadelphia, PA

 **Company Overview**: MetLife Investment Management (MIM) is the institutional asset management business of MetLife, Inc. (NYSE: MET), one of the world’s leading financial services companies. MIM serves institutional investors, including MetLife’s general account investment teams, by combining a client-centric approach with deep, asset-class expertise established over 150 years of disciplined risk-management experience. Focused on managing Public Fixed Income, Private Capital, and Real Estate assets, we aim to deliver strong, risk-adjusted returns by building tailored portfolio solutions. MetLife Investment Management had $587.6 billion of total assets under management as of June 30, 2024, for our institutional clients and MetLife’s general account. Further information is available at investments.metlife.com.

 **Program Description**: MetLife Investment Management’s Summer Analyst Program is a 10-week hybrid internship program providing participants broad exposure to a global investment manager and a specific asset class of their choosing. Summer analysts will develop various technical and soft skills, have the opportunity to network with professionals across the company, and fully immerse themselves in MIM’s culture.

 **Internship Program Dates**: June 2, 2025 to August 8, 2025 (10 weeks)

 **Opportunity**: Candidates will be able to rank their preferences for placement in the following business units and corresponding locations:

 **Public Fixed Income; PFI (Philadelphia, PA; Whippany, NJ)**: The Public Fixed Income summer analyst will support the trading, portfolio management, credit research, and operations functions of Public Fixed Income. The summer analyst will be introduced to high-yield and investment-grade corporate bond trading, structured product investing, credit research, portfolio analytics, and risk management. Time will be shared, and these groups will be supported in various capacities as needed. Within the program, you will work closely with portfolio managers and senior members of the research and trading groups to obtain a working knowledge of and take an active role in the investment process. Public Fixed Income AUM was $311.8 billion on June 30, 2024.

 **Private Capital (Whippany, NJ)**: The Private Capital department is an industry leader in institutional asset origination, managing over $135.5 billion as of June 30, 2024, across Private Corporates, Private Infrastructure, Residential Mortgage Loans, Alternatives, Middle Market Private Capital, and Private Asset-Backed Securities, and is continuing to experience significant growth. Private Capital strategies seek to invest in high-quality private debt securities that offer attractive yield potential, portfolio diversification, potential downside protection, and asset-liability matching. The summer analyst will be responsible for supporting the Private Capital team, including reporting, analysis, presentations, and ad hoc portfolio-related projects, as well as providing support for the more senior members of the team. Placements will be determined based on candidate interests and business unit matching. Summaries of the business units are below:

* **Investment Grade Private Credit**- Our Investment Grade Private Credit strategies include investments in corporate, private credit, infrastructure debt, and private structured credit issuers that offer portfolio diversification structured for asset-liability matching, managing over $91.3 billion as of June 30, 2024. We invest in credits whose transactions we believe are well structured, properly priced and have sufficient relative value compared to other investment opportunities. We have access to a wide range of investment opportunities that allow us to be selective on deals.

  

o**Corporate Private Credit**—strategy that seeks to originate high-quality private debt with enhanced yield potential and diversification characteristics. Our clients’ investments can be tailored to a wide range of maturities as well as to diversification by risk, country, sector, and currency, and structured as fixed and / or floating-rate debt.


o **Infrastructure**—strategy that provides capital for economic and social infrastructure development. This strategy seeks to originate investment-grade, senior secured notes in fully contracted greenfield and brownfield entities with strong track records.


o **Private Structured Credit**—strategy revolves around investing in privately originated asset-backed opportunities across the capital structure. It emphasizes intricate, tailor-made transactions designed to enhance returns while mitigating potential losses. The team maintains sector flexibility and pursues investments in securitization (Asset-Backed Securities) transactions where substantial value is identified. They seek strong risk-adjusted returns on predominately investment-grade investments while opportunistically adding non-investment-grade investments with the goal of enhancing overall returns.


o **Client Portfolio Management**—The client portfolio management (“CPM”) team’s primary responsibility is to understand the client’s private asset objectives, create a mandate and working relationship with the clients to achieve those objectives, and work with the MIM private deal teams to build and monitor the client’s private portfolio.

* **Middle Markets**—The Middle Market Private Capital strategy seeks to offer investors access to privately negotiated debt and minority-equity investment transactions, primarily in North American middle-market companies. Investments include senior, unitranche, and second-lien loans, mezzanine notes, and equity co-investments. Middle Market Private Capital AUM was $1.5 billion on June 30, 2024.

* **Private Equity**—Private Equity Strategy seeks to deliver consistent, attractive long-term private equity returns, both on an absolute basis and relative to industry benchmarks. MetLife’s Private Equity portfolio is invested globally across a broad range of sub sectors, including leveraged buyouts, venture capital, growth equity, special situations, and equity co-investments.

* **Residential Whole Loans**—The Residential Whole Loan strategy seeks to offer investors access to an actively managed residential loan portfolio that aims to generate attractive income relative to traditional fixed-income sectors. U.S Residential Mortgage Loan AUM was $18.4 billion on June 30, 2024.

 **MetLife Insurance Investments; MII (Whippany, NJ)**: MII provides the insurer investment function for MetLife’s general account. Key to this function is developing an asset allocation strategy that enables the matching of investment assets with the liabilities needed to fulfill MetLife’s obligation to customers at some point in the future. The general account portfolio is primarily comprised of fixed-income securities, but it also includes real estate and other equity investments. MII collaborates with its asset manager, MetLife Investment Management, to execute the strategy within a relative value framework, balancing current income and total return needs. The summer analyst will work with the MII team to analyze and implement investment strategies that help achieve earnings, growth, and risk management objectives, as well as assist in building reports to support the investment process.

 **Institutional Client Group; ICG (Philadelphia, PA; Whippany, NJ)**: The Institutional Client Group is responsible for driving the firm’s strategy and business development efforts with institutional investors globally. As a summer analyst, the candidate will work closely with team members, investment professionals, and other key stakeholders in a range of responsibilities related to growing the client business. This includes maintaining and enhancing a CRM system, sourcing prospective investors, researching competitor products, summarizing large datasets, assisting with various business strategy initiatives, and coordinating client/prospect meeting logistics and follow-ups.

 **Insurance Asset Management; IAM (Whippany, NJ)**: MetLife Investment Management (MIM) was launched in 2012 to capitalize on our strong investment management performance for our General Account. The summer analyst will support the management of MetLife Holdings and Corporate & Other Segments. MetLife Holdings portfolios back run-off liabilities such as Life, Annuities, and Long-Term Care. The Corporate & Other segment contains mostly surplus, reinsurance, and hold-co portfolios. The summer analyst will provide ad hoc analysis on various portfolios or other topics. Additionally, the summer analyst will utilize tools such as BlackRock Aladdin, Excel, Bloomberg, and other tools to analyze portfolio issues.

 **Office of the CIO; OCIO (Whippany, NJ)**: The Office of the CIO provides a unique and exciting opportunity to thoroughly understand how the Investments Department’s investment strategy and process come together. The summer analyst in this role will work directly with MetLife Investment Management (MIM) Management Committee members and MetLife Insurance Investments (MII) Senior Leadership Team members. The candidate will compile high-level analyses of critical portfolio information for use by the Chief Investment Officer (CIO) and his direct reports, the Executive Leadership Team (ELT), MetLife’s Investment Committee of the Board of Directors, and MetLife shareholders.

 **Operations (Whippany, NJ)**: The Client Services Group in Operations creates and delivers client reporting related to MIM’s global product agenda, with a mandate to deliver products that support both clients’ needs and business growth objectives. The team also serves as a critical connector for MIM’s clients and Product Strategy to ensure we are delivering on our promises. This role will support the broad activities of the Client Services team. Key responsibilities include assistance with facilitation of client reporting, timely and accurate report generation, ad-hoc client requests, and development of new efficiency processes.

 **Candidate Skills and Qualifications**:


MIM seeks to hire individuals who work well in team-based settings, are highly motivated, intelligent, have sound judgment, have solid analytical skills, and have demonstrated excellence in prior endeavors.

 **Required Skills and Qualifications**:

* Candidate must be currently enrolled in a higher education institution and actively pursuing an undergraduate degree with a strong academic record and a demonstrated interest in finance / economics
* Candidate’s anticipated graduation date must be between December 2025 and June 2027
* Candidate must have a strong worth ethic, personal and professional integrity, and be able to adapt to new challenges in a dynamic environment while handling multiple projects
* Candidate must be able to work independently and in a team environment, remaining detail-oriented and client-focused
* Candidate must have excellent written and verbal communication skills and feel comfortable interacting with management-level professionals
* Candidate must be familiar with Microsoft Office products such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

  

MetLife is committed to building a purpose-driven and inclusive culture that energizes our people. Our employees work every day to help build a more confident future for people around the world.

  

We want to make it simple for all interested and qualified candidates to apply for employment opportunities with MetLife. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request to accommodations@metlife.com or call our Employee Relations Department at 1-877-843-3711.

  

MetLife is a proud Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer dedicated to attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse and inclusive workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment at MetLife without regards to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, uniformed service member or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

  

MetLife maintains a drug-free workplace.

  

In connection with this open position, MetLife will only consider job applicants who are legally authorized to work in the United States without an employer-sponsored petition for a visa, such as an H-1B visa. It will not file any visa applications in connection with this position.

  


  

*The salary range for applicants for this position is $27 - $33 per hour.*
**About MetLife**  

*Recognized on Fortune magazine's list of the 2023 "World's Most Admired Companies" as well as the 2023 Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For ®, MetLife*, through its subsidiaries and affiliates, is one of the world’s leading financial services companies; providing insurance, annuities, employee benefits and asset management to individual and institutional customers. With operations in more than 40 markets, we hold leading positions in the United States, Latin America, Asia, Europe, and the Middle East.  

  

Our purpose is simple - to help our colleagues, customers, communities, and the world at large create a more confident future. United by purpose and guided by empathy, we’re inspired to transform the next century in financial services. At MetLife, it’s #AllTogetherPossible. Join us!
*Equal Employment Opportunity/Disability/Veterans*  

*If you need an accommodation due to a disability, please email us at accommodations@metlife.com. This information will be held in confidence and used only to determine an appropriate accommodation for the application process.*  

  

*MetLife maintains a drug-free workplace.*
$27 - $33 per hour

title: Lab Med Tech.
description:
**Job Duties:**

Performs and interprets automated and manual testing procedures on blood, urine and fluid specimens in the laboratory.  

Evaluates specimen/test orders for acceptance/rejection according to guidelines; accessions specimens accurately.  

Meets established TAT and productivity standards.  

Recognizes and resolves errors/discrepancies or problems and notifies appropriate personnel.  

Is proficient with all IT systems; can order, cancel, retrieve result, review work lists, sample collections, and test status.  

Addresses critical results and delivers STAT results properly according to policy.  

Correlates results with diagnosis and compares previous results if necessary.  

Can operate all Laboratory testing instruments; can recognize, troubleshoot and resolve instrument issues.  

Ensures proper function, maintenance and QC of each instrument; ensures compliance with QC, maintenance, temperature and reagent records.  

Performs proficiency testing and quality audits as needed.  

Ensures compliance with JCAHO, FDA, CAP, AABB and NJDOH.  

Maintain the record of reagents and supply; reports reagents shortage to the supervisor or designee; ensures that all reagents used for testing are in date and show no signs of drift or contamination as indicated in the daily QC data.  

Assists with training new employees, participates in teaching students.  

Demonstrates knowledge and follows to all department safety procedures and policies.  

Ensures proper handling of chemical and bio-hazard materials.  

Works weekdays, weekends and holidays as scheduled.  

Conducts personal business on non-productive time, limits socializing to ensure the work flow continues uninterrupted.  

Shows leadership quality; assumes responsibility in absence of supervisor.  

Attends department meetings and participates in continue education.


**EDUCATION + EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:**  

BS degree from an accredited institution with a major in medical technology.  

Minimum of 1 year clinical laboratory experience, which may be concurrent or subsequent to education, required.  

MT (ASCP) or equivalent certification desired. May be required to meet specific state requirements.

  

  

**CREDENTIALS + QUALIFICATIONS:**  

Degrees from foreign institutions will require credential equivalency evaluation.  

Ability to provide excellent customer service internally and externally. Possess superior written and verbal communication skills.  

Ability to read, understand and follow detailed procedures. Analytical, numerical and reasoning abilities necessary. Proven skills of critical thinking, problem solving, and decision making. Ability to prioritize, organize, and handle a high volume workload efficiently essential.  

Good close vision and color perception required.

title: Front Desk Manager
description:
We are all part of The Fort Team and are only as strong as our weakest link. You will become an expert in your position while also becoming knowledgeable in all functions that make The Fort unique and loved by so many. You are expected to help in other areas, as needed, and be proactive in helping to maintain The Fort facility.
  
  

The primary duties of the Front Desk Manager are to ensure guest satisfaction and the overall efficiency of front office and lobby operations.
  
  

The front desk staff at The Fort often serves as the first point of contact for members and potential members. They play a crucial role in creating a welcoming and friendly environment that encourages regular gym usage and member retention. The Front Desk Team not only handles general administrative tasks but also assists in promoting the gym’s services, answering member queries, and maintaining an organized front desk and lobby area.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

1. Responsible for the hiring, training, and management of Front Desk Staff
  
  

2. Keep Front Desk Staff informed of any new policies or events; Includes the scheduling of periodic staff meetings
  
  

3. Greet members and guests upon arrival and assist them as necessary
  
  

4. Manage member check-ins and monitor gym access
  
  

5. Answer phone calls, respond to inquiries, and direct calls to appropriate staff
  
  

6. Assist in membership sign-ups, cancellations, and updating member account information
  
  

7. Provide information about gym classes, services, and policies
  
  

8. Handle cash transactions and process payments for services, classes, and memberships
  
  

9. Keep the front desk and lobby areas clean, organized, and stocked with necessary supplies
  
  

10. Assist with gym tours for potential members and guests, as necessary
  
  

11. Resolve member issues in a professional and timely manner
  
  

12. Perform other administrative tasks as assigned by management
  
  

13. Keep current with new products and services offered by The Fort
  
  

As Front Desk Manager you are responsible for all of the above in addition to the scheduling and covering of shifts of team members. You are also expected to help out as needed, in the Canteen and with Membership sales.
  
  

Hours
  
  

Minimum of 40 hours per week
  
  

Schedule to be determined
  
  

Compensation
  
  

$42,000 annual salary
  
  

Eligible for benefits and 401(k)
  
  

Complimentary Gym Membership

title: Membership Consultant - Part Time
description:
**Membership Consultant**

**Overview:** As a Membership Consultant at The Fort, you will play a crucial role in promoting our facility and acquiring new members. You will be responsible for driving membership sales through effective lead generation, follow-up, and personalized customer service. This position requires strong interpersonal skills, sales acumen, and a passion for fitness and wellness.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Membership Sales:**
	+ Actively promote membership and services to achieve monthly sales targets.
	+ Engage with potential members both in-person and over the phone to understand their fitness goals and recommend appropriate membership packages.
* **Lead Generation:**
	+ Implement lead generation strategies to attract prospective members.
	+ Follow up on leads generated through referrals, inquiries, and outreach efforts promptly and professionally.
* **Customer Relationship Management:**
	+ Build strong relationships with current and prospective members to enhance retention and satisfaction.
	+ Address member inquiries, concerns, and feedback in a timely and efficient manner.
* **Tour Management:**
	+ Conduct facility tours for potential members, showcasing amenities, equipment, and services.
	+ Present membership options clearly and persuasively, emphasizing the value and benefits of joining our Fitness Center.
* **Administrative Tasks:**
	+ Maintain accurate records of membership sales, leads, and member interactions using our software system.
	+ Assist in processing membership applications and payments, ensuring accuracy and efficiency.
* **Promotions and Events:**
	+ Support marketing initiatives and promotional events to drive membership growth.
	+ Participate in community outreach activities to increase awareness of our Fitness Center.

**Requirements:**

* Proven experience in sales, preferably in the fitness or wellness industry.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Strong customer service orientation with a friendly and approachable demeanor.
* Ability to work flexible hours, including nights, weekends and holidays as needed.
* Knowledge of fitness equipment, classes, and wellness programs is a plus.
* High school diploma; additional education in sales or fitness-related fields is advantageous.

**Attributes:**

* Goal-oriented and results-driven.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Enthusiastic about fitness and helping others achieve their health goals.
* Strong organizational skills with attention to detail.
* Professionalism and integrity in all interactions.

**Benefits:**

* Access to fitness facilities and wellness programs.
* Opportunities for professional development and career advancement within our organization.

**Compensation:**

* Part Time Position, 20 hours Per Week
* A flat rate commission based on memberships sold
* 20% of month-to-month memberships’ first payment, paid monthly
* $20 per hour


Gym Membership
